225501.name: Sestre Penitentiary
225501.description:
(publisher blurb)

Horrible things were done to the inmates of Sestre Penitentiary to satisfy the twisted desires of the wardens. The village of Umoran was relieved when it finally closed and they no longer had to listen to the horrible screams carried on the wind. For 60 years it sat silent, but in recent months people have begun to disappear, and folks say they've seen strange shapes moving in the windows.

This adventure starter for Dungeon World includes monsters, locations and treasures for 1-3 sessions of play.

225502.name: Clockwork Memolion (クロックワークメモリオン)
225502.description:
User summary
クロックワークメモリオン (Kurokkuwa-ku Memorion) Clockwork Memolion is a two player fantasy cardgame. You battle against your opponent by customizing your memory-lost characters by injecting various memories (words). Hence, the same character may be altered to execute different effects and abilities. First one to put your opponents' life to 0 wins the battle.

It's a Print and Play cardgame, supported by a custom website. A player can create a free account, and keep cards they gain on their personal page. Every 8 hours, each player receives a free Gacha giving a random card. But players can also buy a Premium Gacha giving five extra cards, including more rarites. Since the game is entirely PnP, buying cards is the only cost (an income model akin to mobile games) other than printing.

Gameplay is in quick 1 vs 1 deck-driven battles but the rules enable partnership games. Players tune up their decks with new cards they have collected and printed.

https://www.cwm-memories.com/

A Note on the Name: Japanese tend to use the L as an approximation to the R which they don't have. This is intentional, not a mistake. So this game would be spoken in Japanese more as Memorion than Memolion, which comes from the game's theme of lost memories.

Publisher's summary
記憶を失ったキャラクターに様々な記憶(ワード)を入れ能力をカスタマイズしながら戦うファンタジーカードゲームです。
同じカードでも違った効果、能力にすることができます。
先に相手のライフを0にしたプレイヤーの勝利です。

プリントして遊べるカードゲームです。
https://www.cwm-memories.com/
上のサイトに無料会員登録すれば8時間に1回無料でパックを引くことができ、それをマイページに保管することができます。
そこにアクセスすれば好きなカードが印刷できます。

225503.name: Heads or Tales Supplement Bundle 2
225503.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

We're back with a brand new bundle of supplements to jumpstart your next adventures using Heads or Tales! In this bundle, you will find guides for running sessions in cyberpunk, horror, and super hero settings. These guides provide scenario generators for the GM in order to quickly get the opening threads of the story put together, so your group can get into the action even faster. On top of that, they provide helpful world-building questions for the group to discuss to really get a feel for the themes of your story. This is our second bundle, let us know what genres you want included in the next one!

225504.name: Avalon Haunts 05
225504.description:
From publisher's blurb:

Need something a bit scary for your game? Here’s Avalon Haunts! Each issue brings you a unique, fun, and creepy haunt to spice up your games. Drop the them just about anywhere, or build a whole game around the haunt! You will find them easy to use, fun to play, and having your games become creeping with scary fun.

This month we have another haunting tale to scare and thrill your players with.

225505.name: Avalon Haunts 07
225505.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

Need something a bit scary for your game? Here’s Avalon Haunts! Each issue brings you a unique, fun, and creepy haunt to spice up your games. Drop the them just about anywhere, or build a whole game around the haunt! You will find them easy to use, fun to play, and having your games become creeping with scary fun.

This month we have another haunting tale to scare and thrill your players with.

225506.name: The Mantaur
225506.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

A Centaur With The Body of a Human and the Lower Half of... Well Another Human

"Sneaking through the tall grass you happen to spy a ruggedly handsome man, perhaps a bit too tall as his torso is clearly visible above the stalks of grass, with wild black hair and a feral beauty about him. As you draw closer, letting your presence be known you are greeted by another set of hands, far too low for a man. When you get a full view of him you realized it a creature comprised of 50% human and... well, another 50% human. Oddly, though these numbers add up to 100% human, it falls short (or perhaps is in excess...) of what the term “human” normally implies."

Yes, we are gloriously releasing the "mantuar". A mantaur is what happens if you shove the torso of a man on the headless body of a woman or vice versa. The androgynous mantuar are a racial offshoot of humanity with some unique racial traits.

The book's short, cheap, and has 2 magnificent piece of artwork by Rui Ferreira and we hope you enjoy it

225507.name: Peregrine Rock
225507.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

Peregrine is a lost world to be found out on the Fringe. This supplement features all the details of the fantastic creatures and dangers that wait explorers of this strange new world.

As a special bonus with the Infinite Creatures series, each creature comes with their own unique Fringe world (thus allowing for a wider range of environments than are currently cataloged in the populated worlds of the Fringe.) Of course, this in no way means these creatures must be used with this new world, or that they must be used in the Fringe setting. This new Origin World is a way of introducing strange and otherworldly sci-fi creatures into a campaign with as little need for work from the Gamemaster to make that happen. These oddities come with a world readymade to receive them, a world that can be plopped down into any Infinite Futures or space campaign.

225508.name: Victory's Vault Volume 2, Issue 07
225508.description:
From publisher's blurb:

"Every Item Touched by Victory!"

The "good" Lady Nike Wondderra claims to be the keeper of the vaults of the goddess of Victory, and in the pages of Victory's Vault, she offers these items to adventurers and villains alike at remarkable prices! Each installment of Victory's Vaults includes...

A fine selection of weapons of the Era

A unique item of armor

A vehicle the suit the needs of hero and/or villain

A "white elephant," such as a new animal, a playable Package, some new Special Abilities, or a place to explore and perhaps purchase!

Also includes some notes on how Lady Wonderra pitches these fine items, and the potential benefits (or consequences!) of haggling. Want more stuff? You can't do much better than to look in Victory's Vault!

This is a supplement for the Victory System; you will need the Core Rulebook to play. We will also be using material from our supplement Beasts of Victory, you may want a copy for reference. As always, the items (and/or abilities) in this book can be modified and adapted to your specific needs with the use of the Victory System Equipment Manual.

225509.name: Jack's Gang
225509.description:
https://www.facebook.com/andrebertagliagames

Jack's money was stolen by Roger's Gang.

225510.name: Super Unicorn
225510.description:
In the year 1240 Princess Ikio proclaimed all men must find her the Super Unicorn. In order to lure the Super Unicorn, players will roll dice and vie for the special stars needed to complete their search.

In clockwise order, players take turns rolling all dice available, and must lock in dice on up to three different different stacks of cards available or on cards they have earned during the game. They may repeat this process until they want to pass. If they fail to roll a die or dice that can be used, their turn ends immediately. When the stack of cards on the highest rated card is is depleted, the player with the most stars on their face up cards wins the game.

225511.name: The Fog of Ebisu
225511.description:
From the introduction:

A joyful atmosphere fills the town of Ebisu as its residents prepare for the towns centennial celebrations. The streets are lined with decorations and the towns people welcome new travelers with excitement. But when the day ends and the centennial officially begins, in the dark shadow of the moon, terror strikes and the town is set upon by a thick deadly fog. Where has this fog come from? Why is it here? And what horrors lie within the fog?

A 3-5 hour adventure for 1st - 4th level characters.

225512.name: The Tall Witch
225512.description:
The Crying Blades Almanacs: The Tall Witch - Introductory Adventure

From the introduction:

The Tall Witch is a small adventure for OSR RPGs, built as a sort of list of encounters/combats, with a minimalistic approach in terms of background story.

All its elements could be inserted in a more complex framework, or recycled as parts of different adventures/stories.

225513.name: Evil Healers
225513.description:
From the introduction:

At first thought Healers would not necessarily seem the natural choice for an evil mastermind or villain.

225514.name: The Princess and the Dragon Game
225514.description: The Princess and the Dragon Game is an educational game for children teaching reading and matching skills. There are six different games, each of which involves collecting cards to fill the spaces on a board. They involve combinations of matching pictures to words or words to pictures. Some allow players to pick any card, others require them to pick off the top of a stack. One game involves miming words, and another requires players to come up with synonyms.

225515.name: Finding Dory: See Search Game
225515.description:
Help Dory find her family and friends! Dory and her friends are playing Hide and Seek. Where are they hiding? Be the first to find three, and you win.

The game is played on a large board printed 19" x 28" board printed with a pattern of dots designed to obscure pictures of the movie characters. Each player has a diving-mask-shaped viewer designed to reveal the character's picture. Players take turns turning over a card depicting a movie character. Players then race to use their viewers to find that character on the board. The player who finds the character claims the card. First player to three cards wins.

225516.name: Monroviaopoly
225516.description: Monroviaopoly is a city-themed Monopoly clone with a Monrovia, California theme. Spaces on the board represent local businesses and landmarks.

225517.name: Flying Tigers
225517.description:
Flying Tigers is game #4 in the Battle over Britain game series published by Minden Games.

Flying Tigers is an expansion module for the Battle over Britain game system. It may be used with the standard rules contained in any game of the series. It contains solitaire rules, optional rules, several new aircraft and scenarios. You must own the core rues for Battle over Britain to use this module. The rules and planes contained here may be used with any of the other titles in the game series.

Flying Tigers incorporates material from the out-of-print Battle over Britain Solitaire Module and adds new content, particularly the planes and campaign involving the 1st American Volunteer Group fighting with the Chinese Air Force in 1941-42 against the Japanese. The module also contains campaign game scenarios and planes for the Polish (1939) and Dutch (1940) campaigns.

225518.name: Verb Volcano
225518.description:
To reach the peak of the fiery volcano, just identify the correct action words--but watch out for treacherous rock slides!

Verb Volcano is an educational game designed to teach verb forms and tenses. Each player chooses a card with a sentence and several possible verbs that could complete it. If they answer correctly, they spin a spinner to move up a track toward the top of the volcano. Spaces along the track may move players forward or back or grant an extra spin. The first player to reach the top of the volcano wins.

225519.name: Striker Arena
225519.description:
On a distant planet, ancient tribes have settled their wars through an old brutal discipline, Soccer of the Gods. Once every ten years, tribes gather in the Striker Arena tournament to battle each other under the authority of their Emperor. Each tribe enlists the bravest and fiercest of their kin to fight for glory.

These few are known as the Strikers. Their spilt blood and sweat in the arena feeds the Emperor’s ever growing lust for true transcendence.

Source: The Game Website.

225520.name: King Tongue
225520.description:
No pity for bananas in this old-fashioned arcade game! With his tongue-grapple, King Tongue grabs, swings, propels and explodes everything that moves to reach the best scores.

Source: The Game Website.

225521.name: KWAAN
225521.description:
Within a real ecosystem, players must help each other to reveal the different chapters of Kwaan's story.
A mystical adventure game that will make you believe that the pixel is alive!

Source: The Developer Website.

225522.name: Dofus Pogo
225522.description:
A mobile arcade and action game, DOFUS POGO is inspired by the DOFUS movie universe and will allow you to discover this wonderful world in a playful and funny way. Your reflexes and speed will be put to the test!

Source: The Developer Website.

225523.name: Vampire Hunters: Nyx Expansion
225523.description:
An optional Kickstarter exclusive crossover character from the Middara board game which comes with the following that can be used with the Vampire Hunters game:

1 x Elder ID card
1 x Hunter ID card and weapons cards
Downloadable Hunt

225524.name: Visions
225524.description:
Visions is a competitive game where the players collect cards that show clocks. They play the clocks to connect other cards via the hands of the clocks with their mental center. Those other cards represent different topics which belong to family Yates: ancestors, places where they lived, rooms where they used to be and their collection of jewels. While the players are visionary talented people, they try to help family Yates finding out what curse lies on them.

By connecting the family cards at the right time (represented by the clock cards) with their mental center the players gain victory points, visionary power and vision parts in different colors. Each player has got a vision card with a 3x3 pattern where they place the vision parts according to the rules. The players get victory points for full rows and columns.

The players may use the visionary power to change it into benefits, for example reducing the cost to connect family cards with the mental center or getting additional vision parts.
At a given time the player with the fewest victory points decides which sort of visionary power will be blocked for the rest of the game. The benefits which were connected to this sort of visionary power are no longer available and all players have to deal with this limitation.

One family card lies at a special position and can't be connected directly with the mental center but it is possible to connect the card through the other family cards with the center to get the benefits.

The players also have to try to solve a master vision with the vision parts to get extra points and offer the best help for family Yates. Only the one with the most victory points is able to give them the chance to break the curse.

225525.description:
The Folklore: The Affliction - Dark Tales Expansion is a Kickstarter Exclusive box which holds most of the unlocked stretch goals from the Kickstarter campaign.

It contains:

6x new hero miniatures
1x Orinthe the Blood Queen miniature
2x Dark Dryad miniatures
1x Stregha Witch Coven miniatures
1x Otherian miniature
2x The Possessed miniatures
3x Demon Spawn miniatures
2x Highwayman miniatures
2x Banshee miniatures
2x Wretched Hag miniatures
2x Watchman miniatures
4x Hand of Death miniatures
1x Undertaker miniature
1x Vicious Hound miniature
1x Far East Alchemist miniature
1x Valdleany miniature
1x Galastig miniature
1x Arch-Fiend + 3x demonic flame miniatures
1x Bánánach miniature

This is speculated to be in the Dark Tales box, based on the updates from the Kickstarter:
1x Card set Powers of the Otherworld (update 3)
1x Card set Rumors (update 6)
10x new Elite Creature cards (update 19)
2x map tiles 10x10 alchemists tower (update 2)
2x map tiles 10x10 dungeon halls (update 4)
2x map tiles (Dark Spire) (update 5)
2x map tiles 10x10 graveyard + docks (update 19)
2x map tiles 10x10 + 2x passageways 5x10 (update 19)
2x map tiles - 4 locations (update 20)
5x room tiles + 3x long hallways + 2x short hallways (update 13)
(Total of 24 map tiles)

Story Journal: Shadow of the Dark Spire (update 5)
Story Journal: Castles & Manors (update 14)
Story Journal: The Bone Isle (update 19)
Story Book: 2 adventures (update 13)
225525.name: Folklore: The Affliction – Dark Tales Expansion
boardgamefamily: From RPG books to board games

225526.name: Big Bang 13.7
225526.description:
In Big Bang 13.7 you become the universe creators playing with celestial bodies such as coloured planets, stars, asteroids and comets, and also with amazing astronomic phenomenons like supernovas, wormholes or superdestructive black holes.

While the universe expands you can also cause orbits, eclipses, hyperspace or even the mysterious and almost unknown dark energy.

And the main purpose is to align celestial bodies, while a cosmic clock is ticking the passing of time… in milions of years!

HOW THE GAME WORKS

The game is basically composed by hexagonal pieces: 48 celestial bodies of 4 types (planets, stars, asteroids and comets), 4 colours (yellow, orange, red and blue) and 3 backgrounds (empty space, stars and galaxy). There are astronomical phenomena pieces (supernova, black hole and wormholes) and special actions (orbit, eclipse, hyperspace and dark energy). Finally, a cosmic clock will tick the passing of time and players’ turn.

Before the game starts, each player takes two hidden objective cards: a celestial body type and a colour. During the game the player has to manage to be the one who gets more victory points aligning 3 or more celestial bodies consecutively of their own type or colour.

The game starts in the moment 0 of the universe, 13.700 million years ago, placing the first piece: the Big Bang!

In a turn, the player has to place one of the 4 available pieces below the cosmic clock. Two rules are mandatory to place a piece in the universe:

— The piece has to be adjacent at least with 2 pieces and at least one of them has to be a celestial body.

— The celestial body has to have a common characteristic with all the adjacent celestial bodies: same type, same colour or same background.

HOW TO PLACE THE PIECES

The Earth is a wild card that is equivalent to any other celestial body type, colour or background.

The universe can be altered placing some of the 3 astronomical phenomena:

Black hole
A big star that collapses and absorbs all the celestial bodies around it. In the game, the celestial bodies are turned over, with a great destructive potential of alignments.
Supernova: a medium size star that explodes releasing matter and energy giving extra turns of additional celestial bodies for each adjacent piece placed next to the supernova.
Wormhole: alignments or celestial bodies that are very far in the universe can be connected through these two pieces of the tunnel end or portal.
The player can also use 4 special actions that affects only celestial bodies. These actions can be used to amend, create or even destroy alignments:

Eclipse
a celestial body can hide another celestial body by placing it over.

Orbit
a celestial body can be moved following an orbit path around another adjacent celestial body.
Hyperspace: a celestial body can be moved at the speed of light to the other side of the universe.

Dark energy
the universe expansion can be accelerated and the alignment formation too, by placing two new celestial bodies in the same turn skipping the rule of placing adjacent to at least two pieces.
The space-time relationship is very important in the real universe and in the game. Each piece placed in the universe has a duration or cost in millions of years, between 1 and 5 millions years according to its value. Each player pawn will be moved forward in the cosmic clock every time they place a new piece in the universe. The game is not following circular turns, because the turn always belongs to the player who is most behind, so has invested less million of years in placing pieces in the universe.
Clock

Once the game runs out of available pieces and all of them are placed in the universe, the game is over. The players will show their objective cards and will count their victory points based on the alignments according to their two objective cards. The winner is who has most points. In case of a tie, the winner is who is the most behind in the cosmic clock, so has invested less millions of years in pieces.

225527.name: Folklore: the Affliction – Colossal Dark Oak Miniature Pack
225527.description: This miniature is an exclusive model, about 50mm tall, only available through the Kickstarter or Pledge Manager, or possibly at game conventions and the Greenbrier online webstore for a limited time.

225528.name: Lotus Dimension
225528.description:
Lotus Dimension is a tabletop role-playing game (RPG).

Players have to solve all the challenges the
game thrown at them using nonviolent means?
What if a game drew on amazing sci-fi and fantasy storytelling while also incorporating principles of nonviolence inspired by peaceful protests, historical leaders and the tenets of peaceful philosophical practices?

And what if it offered players a way to visualize and role-play solutions to wildly imagined problems, responding to and replacing violence and weaponry with empathy and ingenuity?

225529.name: Lairs of Lost Agharta
rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game
225529.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Level 6 Adventure at the Center of Aereth

Sages will aver that the denizens of the underworld are, by necessity, alien to surface dwellers such as ourselves. Few will ever stand on the ink-black shores of the Lost Agharta, and even fewer will return to tell the tale. Those that do, report creatures transmuted by their deadly environs and the weird gloom. These creatures of legend owe no allegiance or kinship to the beasts of our lit-realms, and woe to the adventurer who mistakes them for a familiar foes.

Collected herein are thirteen of the stranger beings explorers may encounter upon their arrival at the very center of our hollow globe. This is certainly not an exhaustive list, if such a thing could even exist – for the underworld is vast, and our knowledge is slight.

This book of encounters is designed to expand upon DCC #91: Journey to the Center of Aereth, but can also be used on its own.

225530.name: Dream Weed
225530.description:
From publisher blurb:

Deadly Gardens is a series of short PDF documents that each feature a brand new plant monster to use in your Pathfinder Roleplaying Game or OGL campaigns. In addition to a new monster, each volume will also feature supplemental material based around the natural wilderness theme.

In this volume:

Dream Weed CR 10
2 New Magic Items: Accursed Thorns, Silvered Apple
7 New Natural Items: Androsphinx Voice Box, Disenchanter Trunk, Dream Weed Snuff, Giant Gar Scales, Giant Gecko Glue, Shadow Mastiff Eyes, Tatzlwyrm Glands

225531.name: Fraywrack (Pathfinder)
225531.description:
From publisher blurb:

When a flight of harpies, beset by a relentless demonic menace from beneath the dark seas, used their captivating song to lure a ship to ruin, they sought allies instead of food. Thus, was born Fraywrack, a war camp created by the strange alliance of man and monster against a far greater threat. Now, hidden by the broken remains of their ship, the wreck’s survivors and their later recruits train endlessly for a fight they fear they have little hope of winning. Still, they persevere, welcoming adventurers who may wish to learn some lessons of their own or, just maybe, lend their own might to the struggle.

225532.name: Fraywrack (5E)
225532.description:
From publisher blurb:

When a flight of harpies, beset by a relentless demonic menace from beneath the dark seas, used their captivating song to lure a ship to ruin, they sought allies instead of food. Thus, was born Fraywrack, a war camp created by the strange alliance of man and monster against a far greater threat. Now, hidden by the broken remains of their ship, the wreck’s survivors and their later recruits train endlessly for a fight they fear they have little hope of winning. Still, they persevere, welcoming adventurers who may wish to learn some lessons of their own or, just maybe, lend their own might to the struggle.

225533.name: Fraywrack (System Neutral Edition)
225533.description:
From publisher blurb:

When a flight of harpies, beset by a relentless demonic menace from beneath the dark seas, used their captivating song to lure a ship to ruin, they sought allies instead of food. Thus, was born Fraywrack, a war camp created by the strange alliance of man and monster against a far greater threat. Now, hidden by the broken remains of their ship, the wreck’s survivors and their later recruits train endlessly for a fight they fear they have little hope of winning. Still, they persevere, welcoming adventurers who may wish to learn some lessons of their own or, just maybe, lend their own might to the struggle.

225534.name: Greek
225534.description:
From publisher blurb:

Classic Creatures of Mythic Greece

Mythic Monsters: Greek brings you an amazing and exciting assortment of monsters from the legends and lore of Greece, from enchanting spirits of nature to ferocious and legendary monsters fit for the greatest of epic heroes, ranging from CR 2 to 20. Some natives of Greek mythology are friendly and playful like the frolicsome faun and beautiful dryad and their seagoing oceanid cousins. Others may put on a pleasant guise or use their uncanny powers to lure heroes to destruction, like the song of the siren and the harpy or the enigmatic foresight of the cyclops. Some Greek monsters are clad in scales of bronze and iron, like the soaring stymphalides or the petrifying gorgon, and many are misshapen multi-headed monsters like the guardian cerberi or the savage chimera. Finally, the true titans challenged the Greek gods for supremacy, their monstrous brood left behind gargantuan monsters like the twin terrors of scylla and charybdis! As if a dozen existing monsters were not enough, the brand-new stheno, the immortal, brazen-scaled sisters of medusa whose strength and savagery defy description. In addition to the featured creatures, we bring you a bevy of magnificent magic items drawn from the legends of Jason and the Argonauts, the perfect prizes for mythic adventures with a taste for the classics!

225535.name: The Axe Beak Rider, New Cavalier Archetype
225535.description:
From publisher blurb:

Issue #116 introduces the axe beak rider, a cavalier archetype specifically designed for the goblin race (though other small humanoids could also be used with this archetype as well). Forging a bond between two goblin riders and the large and voracious axe beak, this class takes the concept of the mount in a different direction and offers rules mechanics for dealing with dual riders. The Order of the Axe Beak is also included.

225536.name: Mortzengersturm, The Mad Manticore of the Prismatic Peak
225536.description:
From publisher blurb:

After turning himself into a manticore, the self-style wizard-artiste, Mortzengersturm, moved to the crystalline peak of Mount Geegaw to practice his transformation magic without interference. You've been hired to snatch his most prized artifact, the Whim-Wham Stone--or at least some of its eldritch light. A menagerie of magic hybrids, a self-absorbed vampire, more than a few hippogriffs, and of course, the mad manticore himself await!

It's like a Rankin-Bass stop motion special--except it could end in a total party kill. Are you up to the challenge?

Mortzengersturm, The Mad Manticore of the Prismatic Peak is a 5e-compatible adventure for 5-6 players of 3-4th level set in the Land of Azurth. This digital edition contains exclusive extras: a map and brief gazetteer of Yanth Country (the locaiton of Mount Geegaw), and a short excerpt from an upcoming Land of Azurth adventure.

225537.name: Ghastly Gourmands
225537.description:
From publisher blurb:

Monstrous Pages for Shadow of the Demon Lord

Many perils await the travelers who venture beyond the villages and towns speckling the countryside. Among the greatest and most dangerous of these are ogres. Great, lumbering brutes driven by a need to gorge themselves on living flesh and warm blood, they constantly roam, seeking to stuff their gigantic maws with any creature too slow to escape their huge grasping hands or the deadly swing of their giant spiked clubs. Gobbling down their prey, they pay little heed to whatever fur, fleece, filth, clothing, armor, or weapons their struggling victims may have. They ceaselessly want—need—only to eat. And when they have swallowed the last of their meal, they let loose a thunderous belch and move on to find another victim to devour.

In this installment of Monstrous Pages, Ghastly Gourmands examines ogres and all their awful kin. From their horrid origins to an overview of their usual haunts, you will find everything you need in these pages to make ogres a truly terrifying threat in your games. In addition, this entry also expands on ogres by providing customization options and new breeds of these gluttonous people. Read on to learn everything you never wanted to know about ogres!

225538.name: Sword Princess - rollspelet i Amalteas värld
225538.description: Sword Princess is a fantasy RPG in the world of the manga Sword Princess Amaltea. The world has matriarchy, where it is the princess saves the prince, womens that have the power, and men that are the weaker gender. The game is an entry-level RPG, using D6's to make combat and other stuff. The gameplay and tables is made by Tomas Arfert, and the lore by Natalia Batista.

225539.name: Improbable Tales Volume 2
225539.description:
From publisher blurb:

What Do You Need?
Adventures!
When Do You Need Them?
Now!

We've heard demands for more superhero adventures for ICONS.

Here at Fainting Goat Games, we love to write adventures - so we're happy to meet that need.

In this compilation edition - you'll find the following adventures:

Lair of the Wrathmaster
Festival of Fear
Belly of the Beast
The Eaters of Steel
Torc of the Blood Kings
Coils of the Medua

225540.name: Strained Allegiance
225540.description:
From publisher blurb:

In an unusual turn of events, the Gorgon has chosen to enlist mortal agents in her feud with the Dark Queen. The full reasons for her request remain a mystery, but the information she shares is earnest and her offer to cooperate is sincere. Melusine wishes to see Hecate removed from Morden. She is willing to make concessions to the region’s mortal inhabitants—including Accursed belonging to the Order of the Penitent—if they assist her. This alliance of convenience could lead to a tremendous opportunity for the Order, but it is not without risk.

Strained Allegiance is a short scenario that focuses on the adventures of a band of Witchmarked heroes in the Accursed game setting. It is intended for experienced characters, of Veteran level or higher. The adventure may be played as a standalone, or it may be used with the Plot Point Campaign included in Accursed. The adventure features brief scene descriptionss, with necessary game mechanics and opportunity for tasks that can be resolved in a variety of ways.

225541.name: Savage Species: Aliens
225541.description:
From publisher blurb:

Savage Species: Aliens is a racial supplement for the Savage Worlds roleplaying game. Inside this PDF you will find statistics for 20 playable races all alien in origin. The races in this product are designed to be used in almost any Sci-Fi setting. So prepare your imagination with Savage Species: Aliens!

225542.name: Ethermagic Expanded: The Ethershaper Base Class
225542.description:
From publisher blurb:


What is the ether?

The ether fills the void between universes, effectively cushioning creation in its endless gyrations. Were two such universes ever to touch, their likely-incompatible physics would tear each other apart in much the same way as an encounter between a paladin and an anti-paladin. That is to say, one may survive the encounter, but neither are going to look happy when it’s over. In order to prevent this from happening, the ether absorbs the excess translational energy of the entire multiverse, which, in turn, makes it the greatest source of raw energy there is. Mind you, this means the greatest source of energy in the multiverse can be accurately described as a vat of gelatin studded with universes as though they were bits of pineapple.

Not by study, not by blood, but by sheer, dumb luck, a mortal can find himself attuned to the limitless well that is the ether. As an infinite gift with no apparent source or rationale has a tendency to be construed as divine mandate, the vast majority of ethermages are insufferable louts, though some few take their gift and use it for nobler deeds.

How does the ether play?

Ultimate Ethermagic takes equal parts Douglas Adams and H. P. Lovecraft to produce an “all day long” system of magic with a cosmic flavor. Spiritual successors to the warlock base class of the 3.5 days, ethermagic classes seek to have improved playability by offering the ability to mix and match spell effects to make custom evocations on the fly. Whereas the warlock simply blasted, the ethermagician can ask, “How hard?”

Thanks to the advent of a rapidly-regenerating spell point pool, players must choose whether or not to spend more than they will regenerate next turn. Incredibly potent effects are indeed possible, but firing them off without a care in the world will reduce the player to single-target ranged touch attacks in a hurry!

Ethermagic Expanded - The Ethershaper Base Class introduces a new advanced play base class to the ethermagic canon: the ethershaper. Sole user of the new voidshape etherheart (basically a school of magic), the ethershaper combines damage, support, and debilitating effects that can be woven into single spells, but then applies them based on the target’s initiative score at the time. Combined with limited initiative manipulation to allow a single spell to buff one target and deal damage to another, this makes the ethershaper more combo-oriented than any other extant ethermagic class, and as initiative scores will be different for every combat, new combos will need to be created for each fight.

Product Features

The ethershaper base class
The herald of the self archetype, which adds chaos magic to the mix
The new voidshape etherheart with 70+ manifestations
A reprint of the alteration (self buff), bestow (other buff/debuff), and genesis (conjuration) etherhearts, including all manifestations.

225545.name: Avalon Haunts 09
225545.description:
From publisher blurb:

Need something a bit scary for your game? Here’s Avalon Haunts! Each issue brings you a unique, fun, and creepy haunt to spice up your games. Drop the them just about anywhere, or build a whole game around the haunt! You will find them easy to use, fun to play, and having your games become creeping with scary fun.

This month we have another haunting tale to scare and thrill your players with.

225546.name: Avalon Haunts 12
225546.description:
From publisher blurb:

Need something a bit scary for your game? Here’s Avalon Haunts! Each issue brings you a unique, fun, and creepy haunt to spice up your games. Drop the them just about anywhere, or build a whole game around the haunt! You will find them easy to use, fun to play, and having your games become creeping with scary fun.

This month we have another haunting tale to scare and thrill your players with.

225547.name: Extra! Extra!:  A Fact/Opinion Game
225547.description:
Be the first to complete your paper route by answering questions about facts and opinions!

Extra! Extra! is an educational children's game, designed to teach players to distinguish between fact and opinion. Players start the game with five newspaper tokens each. On a turn, they choose a card, read the passage on the card and then attempt to answer the associated question. Correct answers allow the player to roll a die and move. Wrong answers cause loss of a turn. Players attempt to land on purple spaces, which are attached to houses and allow them to "deliver" one of their newspapers. However, they may not deliver to a house that already has a paper. A few spaces contain special instructions, such as extra turns or moves or loss of turns or taking a paper back. The first player to deliver all his/her papers wins.

225548.name: In The Company of Wights
225548.description:
From publisher blurb:

Fuel Your Undying Urge!

Come discover secrets beyond death with the hollowed. They are restless dead, wights, corporeal undead clinging to unlife through the power of a fragment of their soul knows as the Urge. Be the revenant driven by vengeance for its violent death, the devout knight who voluntarily gave its life to serve as an immortal guardian, or even the ravenous master of an undead pack that hunt the living for sport.

This new race and racial class is designed for use by player characters at every level of play of the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game, and provides a full experience of playing as corporeal undead. Presented with the game material is

Hollowed race, with favored class bonuses
Class archetypes including the Night Strider, Pale Rider, and Void Singer
True Wight Paragon Racial Class 1st-20th level that grants you mastery of death!
New race-specific and teamwork feats for the hollowed

225549.name: Eden's Rage (Vol. 1, Issue 1 - Nov 1996)
225549.description:
Eden's Rage
Volume 1 Issue 1
November 1996

The Newsletter of the London Camarilla

225550.name: Eden's Rage (Vol. 1, Issue 2 - Dec 1996)
225550.description:

The Newsletter of the London Camarilla

225551.description:

The Newsletter of the London Camarilla

225552.description:

225555.description:
Eden's Rage

The Newsletter of the London Camarilla

225556.name: Ortus Regni: Shire
225556.description:
2-6 player, Ortus Regni variant.

The largest and most powerful shire in Mercia is before you. The Burhs (towns) of the shire are unique, and each can provide certain important services to its overlord. One Burgh is known for its great warriors, another for its persuasive lords and allies, another for its loyal and capable vassals. Take what Burhs you can, but choose wisely, with an eye on your own strengths and weaknesses.

225557.name: Ortus Regni: Danelaw
225557.description:
2-6 player, Ortus Regni variantmat

The Danes left their Long Boats behind and settled in the North East of your nation. They crushed the Anglo-Saxon kingdom of Northumbria along the way, and now rule a kingdom of their own up north known as the Danelaw! See that they do not take over the whole of England, by keeping them in their place.

225558.name: Ortus Regni: Winchester
225558.description:
2-4 player, Ortus Regni variantmap

Before London was the center of England, before Canterbury was the seat of the English Church… Winchester was the capital of the Anglo-Saxon Kingdom of Wessex and its cathedral was the resting place for many of the first English kings. This is not an era of great urban centers, indeed, but Winchester rises above the other Burhs and fortified towns of the shires. It is the center of both political games and literacy, and hosts much of the pageantry of the kingdom.

225559.name: Fighters of Porphyra
225559.description:
From publisher blurb:

In a War-weary World, you need Fighting Men that do not carry Steel, but are of Steel…

On the Patchwork Planet of Porphyra, war is a way of life, with vastly divergent cultures clashing in campaigns lasting for centuries. Fighters on Porphyra are better, different, with alternate rules to “unchain” the iconic class, and make it a force to be reckoned with!

The myriad and hostile forms of life, and the clash of Deist and Elementalist, and the typical struggles for power have generated many specialists in the art of armed combat. The cavalry-fighting Anticavalier, brave (maybe too brave) Giant-Killer, the legendary Elementalist Immortal, the Janissary, born to be a mercenary, and the Pawn- humble and weak until he meets a powerful boss villain! These and four more fighter class archetypes are present in Aaron Hollingsworth’s Fighters of Porphyra, published by Purple Duck Games! Also included is a new hybrid class, the Elisud, counterpart to the Immortal, a blend of Paladin and Fighter that gets the job done on the front lines, like a good soldier should! Other extras like intriguing new equipment, hybrid weapons for new ways of combat, and a select few magic items and weapon qualities, because a warrior that fights a new way lives to fight another day!

225561.name: Magic Madness 3: Spells For OSR Games
225561.description:
From publisher blurb:

33 new spells. Magic Madness 3. My sword will break but you will feel its full bite. A pit you think you are safe from is right below your feet. We shall sleep with watchful magic protecting us. One step closer and I'll knock those spells out of your head.

These are good spells. Might be better than the ones you have.

Magic 1. Magic 2. Magic 3 we have lift oft. Magic Madness 3 has taken off!

Good spell casting!

225562.name: Galatune: Fan Expansion
225562.description: The Fan Expansion Pack DOUBLES the number of characters in your deck by adding 15 new characters inspired by our Kickstarter fans! Each fan character is competitively balanced and ready to integrate into your Galatune Starter Deck, putting new gameplay options and battle strategies at your finger tips.

225563.description:
"I cannot forget Carcosa where black stars hang in the heavens; where the shadow of men’s thoughts lengthen in the afternoon, when the twin suns sink into the lake of Hali; and my mind will bear for ever the memory of the Pallid Mask." –Robert W. Chambers, The King in Yellow

A new theater production is coming to Arkham all the way from Paris. Unsurprisingly, it's been all the rage in conversations among Arkham's socialites. But in your efforts to learn more about the play, you've uncovered a darker history. Disappearances. Suicides. Delusions. Insanity. Wherever The King in Yellow is performed, madness follows close behind…

In The Path to Carcosa, the second deluxe expansion for Arkham Horror: The Card Game, it becomes your task to uncover the secrets of this unusual play. The expansion's two scenarios kick off The Path to Carcosa campaign with a trip to the Ward Theatre and an invitation to the formal dinner party hosted by cast and crew. But with every answer you gain and every clue you uncover, you only find yourself falling deeper into mystery and madness.

Along with its new scenarios and encounter cards, The Path to Carcosa introduces six new investigators and sixty-two player cards (including a complete playset of each) that afford you new ways to explore and enjoy the game—even as they challenge you to overcome new weaknesses.
225563.name: Arkham Horror: The Card Game – The Path to Carcosa
boardgamefamily: Arkham Horror: The Card Game LCG

225564.name: Empires
225564.description:
Description from the designer:

Empires is a drafting game, where each card has four quadrants. When a player plays a card, he or she plays it in one of these four quadrants, and it has a different effect depending on which quadrant it is placed in.

There is a buying phase after the drafting phase each round, where players will purchase upgrades.

Game Bio:
Become the leader of a local church, and grow it into the largest, most influential church in the country. Bring in money, sell books, and build additions on to your building, all to attract more and more followers.
The player with the most followers and the largest empire at the end of the game is the winner!

225565.name: Mikan de Kyatto (みかんdeキャッと)
225565.description:
User summary
みかんdeキャッと (Mikan de Kyatto) is MIKAN de CAT, a simple stacking game.

In Japan, the combination of oranges (Mikan) and cats is commonplace, and naturally understood. Kyatto is more of a pun on the sound 'kya' which is an exclamation, intended to sound like 'cat'. The game comes from the practise of always always keeping some oranges in Winter on your Kotatsu (a low table, heated underneath).

In this game, players use a cat spinner or cards, and stack oranges in the glass dish, placed on a table. The designer includes five different ways to play. The cat spinner shows a tomcat.

Publisher's summary
テーブルの上に置かれたガラスの器の中に、みかんを積んでいくバランスゲームです。
遊び方は5通りあり、カードを使ったり、ルーレットを使ったりします。

225566.description:
This is a small compilation of FlipFlop 3×3, FlipFlop 5×5, and FlipFour, all playable with the same board and components. The games of the compilation utilize the components as follows:

FlipFlop 5×5 uses the entire 5×5 board, and each player uses 5 pieces.
FlipFlop 3×3 uses just the inner 3×3 portion of the board, and each player uses 3 pieces.
FlipFour uses the the entire 5×5 board, and each player uses 4 pieces.
225566.name: FlipFlop + FlipFour

225567.name: A Game of Thrones: The Card Game (Second Edition) – The Red Wedding
225567.description:
Description from the publisher:

With The Red Wedding Chapter Pack for A Game of Thrones: The Card Game, you'll have the chance to continue the saga of A Storm of Swords with one of the most gut-wrenching and iconic moments of the entire series. Even as you walk among the fallen and the deadly power of House Frey continues to grow, you'll find new ways to spend and earn your gold, like the other expansions of the "Blood and Gold" cycle. With iconic characters like Ellaria Sand, Strong Belwas, Othell Yarwyck, and Walder Frey entering the game for the first time, The Red Wedding brings new horrors and schemes into every game.

225568.name: Anonima Gidierre (Numero 96 - Aprile/Giugno 2017)
rpgissuearticle: Guarda un po' chi si rivede...
Il  terrore e la speranza. Parte XIII
XXIII Trofeo Rill "Il miglior racconto fantastico"

225569.name: Geek Out! Masters
225569.description:
The "Geek Out! Argentina" community reunites people with very particular hobbies, which are represented in the different faces of it's logo die (comics, sci-fi, fantasy, boardgames and videogames).
The objective of the game is to gain the most points by getting dice with the "42" face. Why "42"? Because according Douglas Adams famous novel "Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy", "42" is the answer to the question of the meaning of life, the universe and everything else.
But it won't be so easy since once you roll the dice EVERY die must be activated: Meeples re-roll a die, Spaceships destroys it and Super Heroes reveal it's hidden side. Fortunately Hearts give an extra die, but there are also Dragons, who will make you lose your turn.
Geek Out Masters is a fast and dinamic game, that combines strategy and luck. Are you ready to start the quest of the magic number?

Geek Out Masters was selected by the judges and the public, in 2016, to win the contest made by the "Geek Out! Argentina" gaming community, that asked to design a game using the die in it's logo as a component of it.

225570.name: Wolfe Tone's Rising
225570.description:
In 1796 the charismatic Irish rebel, Wolfe Tone, convinced the Revolutionary government of France and one of its finest generals, Lazare Hoche, that Ireland was poised for rebellion. Ireland would rise, he insisted, if France would only lend its support. That year, a force of 14,000 Frenchmen on 43 ships evaded the British fleet and sailed into Bantry Bay, Cork County, Ireland where rough weather forced them to abandon their operation and return to France.

Two years and three audiences with Napoleon later, Tone tried again. Three waves of French landings were planned to coordinate with a general rising of the United Irishmen (Protestant and Catholic alike) all across the island. Unfortunately, word leaked and key leaders were arrested in Dublin, triggering an early rising, quickly and brutally put down by a combination of professional troops, recently raised fencibles, local militia and orange order yeomen. The rebellion staggered on through September but only in County Wexford and later in County Mayo with minimal French support, did the rebellion meet with any success.

As for the French, the first wave of 1100 men under the able command of Jean Humbert, stormed ashore in County Mayo in August, 1798. A smaller force landed in Donegal in September under the command of Napper Tandy. Humbert enjoyed a few successes but soon surrendered to the overwhelming force Lord Cornwallis brought to bear. Soon after, Tandy abandoned the Emerald Isle when he realized he could no longer be of service to Humbert. A month later and further North off the coast of Donegal, a second wave of 3000 men under Jean Hardy and Wolfe Tone himself met with disaster. Hardy’s fleet ran afoul of the British fleet and Tone was captured. Imprisoned and condemned to hang, Tone committed suicide. The third and largest wave of French soldiers never sailed.

Without determined French support the Irish rebellion of 1798 stood little chance of success. Historically it was a bloody great uncoordinated fiasco made worse by the early demise of Tone’s benefactor, General Hoche to consumption. History might have been different if the stars had aligned, if those key Irish leaders had not been captured and their plans revealed, if the rebels had received a sizeable number of French and British arms, if Hoche had survived. If a second and even a third wave of French regulars had landed, and if those French regulars had landed while the rebellion was still vibrant, then – then, as WOLFE TONE’S RISING reveals, England would have had a serious problem.

WOLFE TONE’S RISING puts the aforementioned what-ifs into play. A short game of seven turns pits English regulars and loyalist militia against the Irish rebels and their French allies. Here, the French play a shell game with the British attempting to land troops in Ireland not once but three times. Here, unknown morale plays a vital role to the outcome of every battle. Here, Local leaders are not cookie cut-outs but individuals who enjoy unique abilities in battle. And here, each battle is assisted by a battle board utilizing fresh mechanics that make each battle a mini-game unto itself. A note on the leaders used: British and French leaders are key historical leaders, whereas Irish rebel leaders are largely representational. Anonymous loyalist leaders represent a mixture of militia and yeomen. Loyalist hierarchy was either nonexistent or too confusing to identify specific names.

225571.name: Piraci: Karaibska flota – Atak Hiszpanów
225571.description:
Can be used on any round and is put out of the game thereafter.

After bidding, the winner of the bidding puts entire sum to the bank. It is not split among players!

The card was added to 23th issue of Świat Gier Planszowych magazine.

225573.name: Tark Piimamees Taskus
boardgamepublisher: The Estonian Chamber of Agriculture and Commerce
225573.description:
"Smart milkman in pocket" in English

Promotional game for The Estonian Chamber of Agriculture and Commerce. Based on Tark Laps Taskus there are thematic pictures of cows and milk production on one side of the card and letters on another side of the card.

Turn around top card and be the first to say something that is on the picture and starting the letter from another card and You get the card as a point. If nobody can´t say anything or there is a tie the card is kept for the next round.
If the deck runs out the player with the most points is the winner.

225574.name: Skyscrappers
225574.description:
Description from the publisher:

Building a skyscraper is tough, but working together might be even tougher. Skyscrappers pits players against each other, only to force them to cooperate a few floors higher. Elevate your status when others fail to be the best person at NOT knocking down a tower.

In this game for 3-8 players, players will be picking cards simultaneously and stacking them on top of a tower, hopefully keeping it standing. Players could be placing cards on their own, or they could be working with the other players to stack a single card on the tower.

The player who is the best at keeping the tower standing wins!

225575.name: Rolling Loot
225575.description:
Rolling Loot is a light pirate themed PnP game where 2-3 player will send their pirate sloops to adventures for their next loot. But they must be quick, determined and lucky to get the treasures before a rival pirate grabs it.

Gameplay:

Cards:
There is a scoring card and eight adventure cards in the game. Each adventure card has 3 requirements/steps for a ship to travel along. If the dice rolled meet the requirements, than a ship can go on an adventure always beginning from the bottom most part of the card. For a ship to advance further on an adventure card, the dice always must match the next requirement to keep on travelling. A ship can at any time during the player's turn abandon the adventure it is on and return to the player’s ship pool. Most of the requirements/steps have a certain amount of loot the player can grab in the left side of the card. Whenever a player ever grabs the loot from the space they are on, the ship is returned in the player’s pool and an unused card is placed in such a way that the amount of loot taken is covered to indicate it is exhausted.
There are 3 levels of cards: Level 1 – Adventures with 0 / 2 / 3 loot x3 Level 2 - Adventures with 2 / 3 / 5 loot x3 Level 3 - Adventures with 4 / 6 / 10 loot x2
Setup:
Every player gets their colored tokens (ships) of choice and make a ships pool in front of them and also a score tracker cube and put them near the scoring card.
Shuffle the Level 1 cards separately from Level 2 and Level 3 and make 2 little decks.
In a 2-player game turn face up in the middle of the table two (2) cards from the Level 1 deck and two (2) cards from the Level 2-3 deck. In a 3-player game turn face up in the middle of the table two (2) cards from the Level 1 deck and three (3) cards from the Level 2-3 deck. These are the current game’s adventures that players can go for to get the treasures they offer.
Players roll a die to determine the starting player. Rest of the game is played clockwise.
Gameplay: (consists of 3 phases for the current active player)
1. Loot Phase:
Before the rolling phase the ships that have travelled in previous rounds can grab the loot from the requirement/step they are on.
When the loot is grabbed, the ship is returned in the player's ships pool and an unused card is placed in such a way that this amount of loot printed on the card is covered to indicate it is exhausted.
If 2 or more ships are on the same step the loot is split between them rounded down. If the loot is the highest one at that time on the card, than it is split and taken immediately by all the players.
If there is a higher step that can be accomplished the non-active player decided if he wants to take his cut from the loot or keep his ship on the step it is on and let the active player take the whole loot.
When the last available loot is grabbed from an adventure card, all ships on this card returned to players' ships pools and the card is turned face down and is inaccessible.
2. Rolling Phase:
The current player gets the 5 dice and rolls them.
Then he decides if he wants to keep some or all of the current dice results and/or he may reroll any combination of dice twice.
The last reroll dice results must be kept as there are.
The smallest combination that can be used for a requirement is of at least 2 dice*.

For the “no even dice” and “no odd dice” steps in the Level 2 cards all unused dice of this round are used to fulfill this requirement.




3. Travel Phase:
After the player decides to stop rerolling or after his last reroll he chooses where he wants to send his ships according to the dice results.
He can send both ships to adventures using the dice results.
Each die may be used only once.
A ship always begins from the 1st requirement/step (bottom part) of the card.
A ship can travel many times during a round.
The ships of a player can be on the same card or on different ones.
Both ships of a player may be on the same card but never on the same step of that card.

Game End and Scoring:
When 2 or less cards remain in game with just 1 available loot step on them, the end game is triggered. All players will play one last round. After that last round, all the ships on adventures automatically grabs the loot from the step they are on if available.
The player who has the most loot wins.
Tie Breaker
If 2 or more players have the same amount of loot, the player who got his amount of loot first is the winner.
To keep track of who got first the x amount of loot, when there is more than one player in a loot space place the scoring cubes one on top of the other to indicate the order of them.

225576.name: Android: Netrunner – Free Mars
225576.description:
Description from the publisher:

With the sixty new cards (three copies each of twenty unique cards) in Free Mars, the fifth data pack in the "Red Sands" cycle for the Android: Netrunner living card game, it's time to see how far the Clans and their Runner allies will go to keep Mars for Martians! So strap a milspec laser to your exosuit and call in every favor you can because the revolution is here!

225578.name: Runewars Miniatures Game: Essentials Pack
225578.description:
Description from the publisher:

Enter the battle for Terrinoth! The Runewars Essentials Pack gives you all the non-figure accessories you need to play the Runewars Miniatures Game. Tokens, terrain, templates, cards, and dice are all included in the pack to help field the various armies of Terrinoth. Use upgrade cards included in the pack to further customize your armies, before leading them to glorious victory!

225579.name: Runewars Miniatures Game: Latari Elves – Army Expansion
225579.description:
Description from the publisher:

Expand your Runewars Miniatures Game experience with the Latari Elves Army Expansion. This expansion not only introduces four new units and eight new figures to the Runewars Miniatures Game, but a brand-new faction in the form of the Latari Elves. Nimble and ferocious, the Latari Elves change the rules of war in the land of Terrinoth!

225580.name: Terminus Breach TD
225580.description: This page does not exist. You can edit this page to create it.

225581.name: Petrichor: Flowers
225581.description: Petrichor: Flowers is an expansion that emerged naturally during playtest and development. It includes 3 new field types - the titular flowers, and enough components to play the game with 5 players.

225582.name: Fallout: New Vegas – Beyond the Wasteland
225582.description:
User Summary

The world of New Vegas is more expansive than ever. Each new distinct area presents a fresh set of branching-quests, remarkable personalities and more chances to play the Savior or the Pariah to the natives of New Vegas.

225583.name: Star Wars: The Card Game – Aggressive Negotiations
225583.description:
Description from the publisher:

Aggressive Negotiations is the second Force Pack in the "Alliances" cycle for Star Wars: The Card Game. Its sixty new cards (two copies each of five new objective sets) explore the loose associations between the galaxy's underworld informants and the Empire's Troopers, Droids, and jailers. Simultaneously, light side players can reach out to the Force alongside Chirrut Îmwe and the Wookiees of Kashyyyk, using their talents to avoid dark side opponents eager to hunt them down, take them captive, and extract whatever secrets they may know.

225584.name: Beat City
225584.description:
Author's blurb:

Beat City is a story about a group of friends, each of whom, in their own way, have said "No thanks" to the established community and have dropped out of society, in search of something else. Another meaning in life.

Beat City is about restlessness; whatever you do, you will never fit into the materialism and emptiness of the outside world. It's about the road, about making some time to just go. To seek meaning in the world. Beat City is a story where players themselves decide the time and place.

The scenery is heavily inspired by the novel "On the Road" by Jack Kerouac and his contemporaries, "the Beat Generation".

225585.name: Det Hemmelige Selskab
225585.description:
Author's blurb:

Five old friends find traces of a lost and secret company. In their search for answers, they open doors. Doors that quickly close behind them and prevent retreat. They step in the footsteps of the lost company and perish in an indescribable world of terrible secrets.

User summary:

This scenario is distributed as three separate PDF files:


34-page scenario
37-page character sheets (US Letter)
18-page print-and-play handouts

225586.name: Pyramidice
225586.description: Pyramidice is an abstract game for four players in which they must create pyramids in descending order starting with 6 and ending with one, each color determines a player and this one decides who dominates a pyramid, the player who dominates two pyramids automatically wins the game.

225587.name: Feats for Skills
225587.description:
From the introduction:

This document introduces new feats to playtest. Each of these feats is associated with a skill....

225588.name: Epic PVP: Magic – Dark Times Expansion
225588.description:
A 4 Deck Expansion featuring:
Sporeling, Gorgon, Hex Mage, and Time Wizard

225589.name: Antagonist
225589.description:
User Summary

Play as D’Vil, the Dark Lord… and rising star at Evil Productions. Team up with Hero of Light, Ralph, and unleash devastating combos on your foes.

225590.name: Blue Rose Narrator's Kit
225590.description:
From the cover of the booklet:

The Blue Rose Narrator’s Kit is the key accessory for Blue Rose: The AGE RPG of Romantic Fantasy. This kit provides a study hardcover stock game screen, complete with all of the essential reference tables you need while running the game, saving you time and placing important information right in front of you.

In addition, the Narrator’s Kit provides a set of seven complete starting Blue Rose characters from a variety of classes, races, and backgrounds, each with multiple customization options. These sample heroes are great to get you started playing the game right away as well as useful examples for players creating their own characters and as prepared characters for a quick one-time game.

With the Blue Rose Narrator’s Kit and Blue Rose: The AGE RPG of Romantic Fantasy, you have everything you need to get right into the fantastic world of Aldea and the adventures of the envoys of the Sovereign’s Finest. Your stories are just waiting to be told!

225591.name: Macbat 64
225591.description:
Macbat 64 is a low poly 3D Platformer and 4:3 loveletter to the late 90s.

Source: The Developer Website.

225592.name: Yozora Rhapsody
225592.description:
Sorata Hoshikawa just got a promotion at his work. Perfect opportunity to spend an unforgettable vacation on a tropical island with his pretty wife Kotoko and his cute daughter Hotaru!

Source: The Developer Website.

225593.name: Red Barton and The Sky Pirates
225593.description:
Red Barton and the Sky Pirates is an exciting 3rd person arcade combat flight shooter reminiscent of games like Star Fox back on the classic N64 and the legendary “After Burner” arcade.

Source: The Game Website.

225594.name: Coffence
225594.description:
User Summary

Coffence is a high-octane fighting game combining the elegance of fencing with the pure joy of a tasty coffee. Partake in one on one caffeine fueled combat where your cup and your wits are your only weapons.

225595.name: IronWolf VR
225595.description:
User Summary

IronWolf VR is a roomscale submarine game playable either singleplayer or online co-op with motion controls.

225596.name: A Large Quantity Of Mushrooms
225596.description:
ALQOM: A Large Quantity Of Mushrooms is an interactive experience for virtual reality, combining elements of adventure, exploration and horror genres.You find yourself in a dark, surreal world full of mysteries and inhabited by strange creatures.

Source: The Developer Website.

225598.description:
"When Death rides his pale horse to you doorstop, will you meet him on your knees or with a smirk?"

World's End Publishing released this expansion scenario in time for Halloween 2016.

The scenario recreates a legendary tale form the This is Not a Test universe where three famous wastelanders were surrounded by a horde of rad-zombies and sold their lives dearly.

The scenario outlines a game that may be played by 1-3 players which recreates this legendary event.

The goal of this scenario is to survive for as long as possible against the endless horde of irradiated monste
225598.name: This Is Not a Test: Skull-Deep in the Dead

225600.name: Runewars Miniatures Game: Oathsworn Cavalry – Unit Expansion
225600.description:
Description from the publisher:

Few sounds strike more fear into an enemy of Terrinoth than the thundering hooves of a column of armored destriers. Each mount is bred and trained for war. Each rider is a lifelong professional warrior or an avowed knight, sworn to a baron’s or Free City’s service until the rider’s final breath. Rider and mount work together on the battlefield in perfect synergy, charging into combat and crushing the enemy in a wave of steel.

With the Oathsworn Cavalry Unit Expansion, you gain four new Oathsworn Cavalry figures—enough to field a two-tray unit or increase the size of another unit. These fearsome knights are sworn to fight for the Daqan Lords and protect the realm, and they are first introduced in the Runewars Core Set. This unit expansion is a perfect way to quickly increase your cavalry and unlock new options with five new upgrade cards for any army.

225602.name: Eddie, pass auf!
225602.description: The game re-themes Funny Bunny with groundhoges, who have to hide from an eagle. Groundhog-pawns are moved heading to the finish and number of spaces are determined by a deck of cards, just like in the original. What distinguishes this game is, that multiple pawns have to be brought to the end spaces, and that a speed element is added to the game. Whenever an eagle card is revealed, a button is pressed, which randomly might activate the eagle. Players are supposed to only hide their groundhogs, if the eagle takes off from behind a bush.

225603.name: Assault Red Horizon 41
225603.description:
In Assault Red Horizon 41, a first module for a tactical level wargame, players can lead historical units into the battles of Operation Barbarossa (June through October 1941). Two factions — the German army and the Soviet army — fight one another with single vehicles as well as gun or infantry units.

Assault Red Horizon 41 is consciously not an accurate simulation of reality, abstracting the reality in favor of the playability and duration to convey the feeling of comprehensible tactical combat situations.

225604.name: Enishi no hi (縁ノ日)
225604.description:
User summary
縁ノ日 Enishi no hi is a Japanese card game set during a Matsuri.

Players manage street stalls at the local shrine festival. Every turn you can acquire new stall cards and trade to collect stall cards of the same genre or numeric value. Business begins on the day of the festival and the sets of stalls you own will decide how much you earn in profits. When the final settling of accounts is over, the player in possession of the most money wins.

Publisher's summary
プレイヤーは縁日に出店する露店を取り仕切っています。毎ターン1枚ずつ露店カードが獲得できますので、それをジャンルか数値で同じものを揃えるようにトレードしましょう。縁日が開催されると決算が発生しますので、所有するセットを参照して収入を獲得してください。最後の決算が終了した時点で、一番所有金額の多いプレイヤーが勝利です。

225605.name: Hailing Frequencies (Episode 01 - Welcome to Epsilon Company)
225605.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

Episode 01 - Epsilon Company - High Tech Scavengers

Employ the company of mercenaries known for turning salvage into effective gear! The Epsilon Company may be criminals wanted by their own race, but that doesn’t mean they’re the bad guys. Framed for the theft of a device of great importance to pasimachi kind, they went on the run to prove their innocence. Learning to make the best of the gear they possessed, the company has not only survived but thrived on the challenge that their new life on the run gives them. Epsilon Company has a saying: “Salvage, adapt, succeed!”

Editors Note - Kris wanted to do something neat and he threw the idea out one day, "What if we did a cool take on the A-Team, but with our bug race, the Pasimachi? While we are at it, let's throw in some cool new gear like an arctic suit of armor for space travel!". The Starjammer design team mulled this over for about 30 seconds before we said, "DO IT! DO IT NOW!", in our best Arnold voice. The rest, as you will read, is history! We hope enjoy the first of our weekly installments of Hailing Frequencies where we get to showcase cool things about Starjammer with new and established authors!

225606.name: Jumping Ship
225606.description:
From publisher blurb:

Re-writing the Rules

Runners are rule-breakers. Lawless. Independent. But their dirty secret is that they don’t break all the rules—they just are more open in choosing which rule sets they should follow. And sometimes, they just make up their own rules. Some of those rules are based on what brings them the most money. Others talk about honor and loyalty, concepts that are incredibly important to some runners and derided as useless baubles by others.

Whatever rules runners invent for themselves, there are times they are tested. And one of those times is coming up.

Plenty of runs don’t end like they should, but what’s really rare is when runners get to take a run that blows up and stick on their own ending. What starts as an extraction quickly goes south, and the runners are going to have to figure out which rules they’re going to follow to make the ending stick. Who will be happy, who will be angry, who will get paid, who will get dead—runners will have to invent rules that can help make all those questions come out right.

Jumping Ship is a Prime Mission for Shadowrun, meaning it is for experienced runners who have graduated out of the regular Missions line. It is for use with Shadowrun, Fifth Edition, and the plotlines can also be used with Shadowrun: Anarchy.

225607.name: Personas: Dhil-K
225607.description:
From publisher blurb:

Put on your happy face.

Dhil-K is not the most famous thief in the galaxy and that’s what makes her one of the best allies a Crew could have. Little known, quiet and careful few assume the little, walking, cube with the emoji face is anything more than innocent. Trained in the arts of espionage, Dhil-K can acquire anything from anywhere in the galaxy. But beware, Dhil-K looks out for number one and may not hesitate to leave the Crew holding the bag. Does your Crew care to engage in business with Dhil-K? This persona for Skum of the Stars features:

Full profile for Dhil-K.
Ideas for linking social Talents to the character.
A guide for using Infamy with the Dhil-K.
A short piece of introductory fiction.

225608.name: Chipmonk
225608.description:
From publisher blurb:

Critter Whisperer

Cheryl Dipsee grew up in the crime-ridden streets of Chicago, unafraid because she was the daughter of the notorious super villain Mammal Master!

Initially a part of her father's crime gang, Cheryl turned away from them, and her life of crime, to make a better life, and a better world as the heroic Chipmonk (PL 10)!

In the years since her debut, Cheryl has teamed up with an unlikely assortment of heroes, and also made a number of enemies, including Hecate, Lord d’Arc, and Nekrotron.

Super Powered Legends. Because sometimes what you need is a character everyone will recognize, even if they’ve never met her before.

225609.name: The Cruorchemist
225609.description:
From publisher blurb:

Strange Name, Wyrd Abilities

Much like sorcerers, the cruorchemist draws power from her unusual ancestry, yet her familial ties are far less obvious and much of her powers are recessive and lie dormant. She can draw upon this power to cast a limited number of spells, but lacks the efficacy possessed by a true sorcerer. For this reason, she learns to manipulate the innate magical power that flows within her blood, and uses alchemical processes to refine and concentrate these magical energies to create distillations that unlock bloodline abilities and greatly enhance her spells.

225610.description:
Description from the publisher:

Smolensk: Barbarossa Derailed is the latest release in the Operational Combat Series (OCS), covering the campaign along the Moscow highway in the summer of 1941. These actions set the stage for the Wehrmacht’s autumn drive on the Soviet capital, and many historians believe the bitter fighting here ultimately doomed the Axis to failure in Russia.

The game begins on 8 July with Barbarossa still in high gear. In August, the advance stalls as Hitler diverts most of the panzers from the map to forces around Leningrad and Kiev. Soviet counteroffensives will push Army Group Center close to the breaking point by game’s end on 8 September. The asymmetry of the two armies will be familiar to veterans of past OCS campaigns, especially Guderian’s Blitzkrieg II. There is the expected qualitative difference in typical Action Ratings, along with stark contrasts in logistical capabilities and replacement rates. There also some unique twists in the situation, including:


Three of the panzer divisions are getting their first taste of combat, so their Action Ratings are reduced.
The rivalry between Heinz Guderian and Hermann Hoth makes it difficult for these generals to coordinate their panzer armies, and might prevent the ring from closing around Smolensk.
Soviet tank divisions are shown for the first time. They pack a wallop, but their quality leaves a lot to be desired.
The Soviet 1st Motorized Division is presented as a somewhat elite multi-unit formation that includes some heavy KV-1s and T-34s.
The contributions of small militia, tank, and anti-tank units are reflected by the Soviet Alarm Pool.
Other chrome accounts for ‘tree bark soup’ (used by cut-off units), planes diverted to terror-bomb Moscow, and special markers for artillery ammo & katyusha effects.


Smolensk is a small and fairly simple entry in the series, with special rules kept to a minimum. We think players will enjoy the fact both sides must attack and defend. By the end they will learn three things about this campaign: the Soviets are more than just punching bags, the Germans are challenged to hold their early gains,
and the road to Moscow will be paved in blood.

Seven scenarios are included:
Intro Scenario: Vitebsk, 1/2 turn, using about 1/4 of the map
Smolensk Campaign, 8 July to 8 September (19 turns)
Late July Start, 22 July to 8 September (15 turns)
1st Counteroffensive, 22 July to 1 August (4 turns)
Early August Start, 8 August to 8 September (10 turns)
2nd Counteroffensive, 8 August to 22 August (5 turns)
3rd Counteroffensive, 26 August to 8 September (5 turns)
225610.name: Smolensk: Barbarossa Derailed

225612.name: Divinities & Cults Volume II: Roman & Celtic (DCC)
rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game
225612.description:
From publisher blurb:

EVEN MORE CLASSIC DEITIES FOR DCC RPG!

Have you unleashed the mighty power of Divinities and Cults in your game yet?

Divinities and Cults: Volume II covers the Gods and Goddesses of both the Celtic and Roman Pantheons, as well as a number of Evil Cults. Like Volume I, this work provides detailed tenets, special cleric considerations, healing side-effects, numerous divine tests, and custom spell lists for all 19 of them. What is more, optional rules and random tables abound, organized by Divinity, of course. This excellent book is compatible with the Dungeon Crawl Classics Roleplaying Game™!

Detailed rules for playing clerics of 7 Celtic and 7 Roman Gods and Goddesses
Full rules for also playing clerics of 5 Evil Cults
20 pieces of unique artwork by Luigi Castellani (note: some Goddesses are depicted partially nude)
11 Random encounter tables
7 Other random tables
20 Optional rule & sidebar sections
An Appendix that offers guidelines for making over 20 additional Divinities, as well as having cultural variations for clerics of the various Divinities, such as Ionian, German, Etruscan, Gallic, etc.
And much more!

225613.name: Last Night on Earth: Hero Pack 2
boardgamefamily: Last Night on Earth Game Engine
225613.description:
The Hero Pack Two Expansion for Last Night on Earth: The Zombie Game introduces four exciting new Heroes. Each character has a highly detailed plastic miniature and Character Sheet. Also included are new game cards and a challenging new Scenario.

This product requires the Last Night on Earth: The Zombie Game board game to play.

225614.description:
From the publisher

It's no secret that Millennium Blades is the best game we've made in the past thousand years! Now you can celebrate this momentous occasion with the Game of the Millennium Upgrade Pack!

The Game of the Millennium Edition provides an alternate box cover art for the game, in the form of a box wrap (which can be easily removed). It also comes with 12 Alternate Art Character Cards, featuring the 12 gamers from the base game, Set Rotation, and the Card Fusion Promo Pack!
225614.name: Millennium Blades: "Game of the Millennium" Upgrade Pack

225615.name: Panzer Attack: War in Russia
225615.description:
Panzer Attack: War in Russia is a fast-paced, easy to learn, deck building, card game that captures the epic scope of World War 2 combat on the Eastern Front. The core game abstractly simulates the war between Germany and the USSR between 1941 and 1945, and the territory cards included allow players to fight along Army Group Center's path between Berlin and Moscow. Additional add-on modules add more cards for greater customization possibilities, and open up new campaign options.

The game uses deckbuilding aspects that allow players to customize their deck to fit their preferred play style, and features play that only requires the cards themselves in order to play a game.

The objective of the game is to either destroy all of your opponent's forces in play, or capture all territories on the board. This is done using troop and unit cards that represent the troops, equipment and historical units that fought in the war, in addition to action and leader cards that add variability and an extra layer of strategy to the game.

225616.name: Super Advanced Wizards of Cockblock Forest
225616.description:
From publisher blurb:

Friendships will be broken, wingmen will betray those for whom they wanged, and many fligglenaxes will be slain in Wizards of Cockblock Forest: a Dungeons & Dragons tabletop RPG parody game.

Cockblock Forest is a place like no other! Actually, it's a lot like Brooklyn, if Brooklyn were populated by goblins and dragons, as well as hipster d-bags. To become this world's most powerful Wizard, convince ambisexual Faeries to have sex with you. When a Wizard "gets it on" with a Faerie, the Wizard gains magic power, and the Faerie gains many enchanted regrets!
