225862.description:
From the introduction:

Find the witch and see if she's the hell-raising kind... If so, then sort her out.

225863.name: Evil, Crazy Magic Person
225863.description:
From the introduction:

Like last time, find the potentially evil, crazy magic person and if indeed they are cray-and-mad then put them down hard.

225864.name: Easter Special
225864.description:
From the introduction:

Retrieve a prototype device that might destroy the world as we know it - if it falls into the wrong hands. Right... sounds like someone pinched their new toy and they just it back... boring... oh well, they are paying well.

225865.name: Lady M's Diamond Caper 1/11
225865.description:
From the introduction:

Well, well, new patron... I like that... Lady M - going to need to research her but for now she's paying well to go steal a big shiny diamond. Awesome! And I think she liked me!

User summary:

This is the part one of an eleven part series that combine together into one continuous story.

225866.name: Lady M's Diamond Caper 2/11
225866.description:
From the introduction:

Break into this private museum and recover the remains of a jewel-encrusted necklace. The remains should have a gap in the centre where the diamond from the previous job fits.

User summary:

This is the part two of an eleven part series that combine together into one continuous story.

225867.name: Auctioneer
225867.description:
Description from the rulebook:

It is the purpose of each player to buy at auction articles put up for sale by the auctioneer. Each article has a hidden value revealed after its purchase by the Highest Bidder. If the buyer purchases the article at less than the revealed value, he scores a profit. If he pays more than it's worth, he loses the difference. The winner of the game is the player with the highest amount of money remaining after all articles are auctioned off.

Before play begins each player secretly decides what each article being auctioned is worth and writes the dollar amount on a slip of paper and then inserts the paper into the article envelope. Each player begins with $1,179 and uses this money to bid on articles placed at auction.

The "auctioneer" title is passed from player to player and the number of items auctioned per auctioneer turn is determined by the number of players (articles should be divided up so each player has an equal number to auction off. The game instructions use groups of five). After each item is auctioned, the article envelope is opened and the slips are totaled. The auctioneer acts a the bank and either collects money from the bidder if the amount bid is more than the revealed value or pays the bidder if the revealed value is more than the amount bid.

225868.name: Lady M's Diamond Caper 3/11
225868.description:
From the introduction:

Rescue Franz! Some nut jobs calling themselves "The Court" have him. Seems they're pretty mad about our recent jobs. Net to get him back pronto!

User summary:

This is the part three of an eleven part series that combine together into one continuous story.

225869.name: Lady M's Diamond Caper 4/11
225869.description:
From the introduction:

Find Narzgul and end him. Franz tells me he's sworn to hunt down and kill Ivy (Franz's girlfriend). That's not happening.

User summary:

This is the part four of an eleven part series that combine together into one continuous story.

225870.name: Lady M's Diamond Caper 5/11
225870.description:
From the introduction:

Investigate these "Court" jokers. Hidden cults never mean well. Stealth time, best leave Franz out of it, he means well but he's clumsy! This mansion is supposed to be one of their bases.

User summary:

This is the part five of an eleven part series that combine together into one continuous story.

225871.name: Backstage Pass (2016)
225871.description:
Backstage Pass is a visual novel/sim game produced by sakevisual. It follows the life of Sian Goodin as she juggles her first year in college with her work as a professional makeup artist. Gameplay is in the style of a stat-raising otome game.

Source: The Game Website.

225872.name: Session Zero (Issue 1 - Apr 2017) The Smoldering Swamp

225873.name: The Game of Abbie an' Slats
225873.description: Simple children's race game based on comic strip characters. First player to reach the end by the exact number wins. The strip was written by Al Capp and drawn by Raeburn Van Buren and ran from 1937-1971.

225880.name: Stadt Land Spielt Limitierte Sonderdrucke 2013
225880.description:
A single punch board containing expansions for 4 different games - Elfenland, Zooloretto, Belfort, and Stone Age.

Expansions are:
Elfenland: Back to the Roads
Zooloretto: Tapir
Belfort: Guild Promo Pack #1
Stone Age: Casino

It was released for the Stadt Land Spielt event that took place on September 2013 throughout Germany.

225881.name: The Alchemist
225881.description:
From the introduction:

Best described as beyond the edge of town, lies an abandoned farm. This is not a place that has been shunned for generations. The farm was abandoned just five years ago amongst rumours of ghosts and hauntings.

225882.name: Ils Sont d'Ailleurs
225882.description:
Five New Adventures

User summary:

This French-language compilation presents five complete scenarios:


Le Chien des Somerville
Réveillez les Morts
Le Géant de Severn Bank
Les Mordeurs-de-doigt
Le Presbytère Hanté

225884.name: Star Trek: Alpha Quadrant
225884.description:
Publisher's blurb:

In Star Trek: Alpha Quadrant, each player assumes the identity of a Starfleet officer or enlisted person. This book contains everything needed to create characters, equip them, and send them on their way. The player will explore strange new worlds and seek out new life and new civilizations. Each game brings about new adventures as the players explore the unknown in the depths of space.

Star Trek: Alpha Quadrant is recommended for three or more people, ages 12 to adult.

225885.name: Unbroken
225885.description:
Description from the publisher:

Not all adventures end well. Some groups meet their untimely demise at the hands of monsters all too soon, and Unbroken is a story of one such ill-advised expedition.

You, the player, take on the role of the sole survivor of that failed adventure. Finding yourself in hostile territory, weak and wounded, you will need to gather your wits and strength, craft weapons from scraps found around you, and attempt to tackle progressively more challenging monsters on your way out of this forsaken place.

Unbroken is a solo card game that is quick to set up and play but one that will produce a tense challenging experience.

You will collect resources representing your character's abilities and will need to ensure that you invest in a right mix of resources to both keep yourself alive during your travels and also prepare for the gruesome monsters that wait in the dark. There are several options at your disposal - brute force, trickery, clever use of skills.

Customize your character and use your limited resources wisely - only the craftiest and the most resilient survivors will make it out alive.

225886.name: North Vs. South: A Civil War Card Game
225886.description:
Description from the designer:

A card based strategy card game where players are trying to secure the most cities as possible before the fight between the North and South is over.

Players will obtain cities as they go and try to hold as many as possible by placing defense cards to protect and keep them.

Other players will use attack cards to attack the cities and acquire them, while drawing from the deck. Drawing from the deck will allow players to build their army and obtain free cities to keep and defend.

The game ends when Abe Lincoln, the Emancipation Proclamation, Gettysburg address and Appomattox courthouse are drawn. The players with the most cities at the end of the game wins.

225887.name: 2099 Wasteland
225887.description:
From publisher blurb:

NUCLEAR FIRE HAS CONSUMED THE WORLD in this 5th Edition OGL campaign setting sourcebook for apocalyptic science fiction roleplaying!

This alernate timeline of Hypercorps 2099 has been wracked by atomic weapons, the surface of the Earth raised and nearly devoid of life. Recently miraculous events have made the world a bearable place for those who hid below in underground shelters and as they explore the apocalyptic planet, the mutants and other survivors that have claimed the land as their own fight for this new stock of wide-eyed prey.

Can you survive 2099 Wasteland?

Unlike many other campaign settings the 2099 Wasteland is not static — it is a campaign setting generator. Every GM and party of survivors that explore the Wasteland uncover a landscape unique to them built using the rules systems inside this fantastic fully-illustrated (perhaps overly illustrated) 183 page book!

What you'll find in 2099 Wasteland:

An indepth timeline following the original Hypercorps 2099 until this alternate world splits off in the mid-20th century!
4 original classes for 5th Edition: master serums as a doctor, transform into a mutated freak, stalk the Wasteland in power armor as a mechanics, or destroy your foes with SCEINCE as a scrapper!
13 different class archetypes for all core classes to bring the original rules into the brutal apocalyptic future!
10 character backgrounds: alien abductee, Atomic Army cadet, feral raider, medic, radiation refugee, scientist, shelter captain, shelter dweller, and survivalist!
4 new races wandering the Wasteland: synthetic androids, gaxian aliens, lumbering mutants, and nearly-undead smart walkers!
8 pages worth of new items, tool kits, prosthetics, grenades, melee weapons, ranged weapons, and CUSTOM-BUILDING RULES for BOTH!
Over a dozen feats for Aimed Shooting, enhancing mechaframes, healing through radiation, fighting tactically, and a host of other unique new abilities!
10 spells designed for use on this scorched Earth or any other world!
New rules for dehydration, radiation, starvation, the Science and Technology skills, and three new attributes: Irradiated, Luck, and Reputation!
Life in the Wasteland detailing radio towers, wandering undead, magic bag couriers, the altered short rest and long rest rules (1 day or 1 month respectively—good luck!), fast searching ruins, Vend-Co Drinks & Snacks, ranged critical failures, options for a less brutal Wasteland, and more!
Settlement rules because after the PCs have explored their Wasteland, the next task is rebuilding society as they see fit!
Hazards of the Wasteland that plague settlements and explorers alike, ranging from bandit attacks and radtwisters to unexpected detonations!
SIXTY-THREE (63!) monsters and NPCs of all challenge ratings! Rad-dragons, rad-drakes, building-sized atomic mutants, brain slugs, technomages, Atomic Army soldiers, Knights of the Living Dead, The Wyrm, walkers—the list goes on!
6 unique Warlords of the Wasteland and their retinues each with a mapped headquarters! Major Bridgette Beauregard of the Atomic Army, Chainbeard's Roadmasters (along with two pages of VEHICLE RULES!), the Cult of Slaarsh, Merlin (yes, that Merlin) and the Magitechnologists, Morgan le Fay, and The Bureau!
13 surviving operators from the pages of Hypercorps 2099, either dimensional counterparts or in the case of Lucky Mack, one unfortunate mercenary that stumbled into the wrong portal.

225888.name: Fast Encounters: The Mud Mephit Lair
225888.description:
From the introduction:

Some mud mephits elected this cave as their lair. This is a natural cavern that have a small murky pond in the middle, filled by the dripping waters from a stream flowing in the open of a forest, that jumps down, in front of the cave entrance, forming a small waterfall.

225889.name: Arena Of Khazan (Deluxe)
225889.description:
From publisher blurb:

Khazan, capital city of the Empire of Khazan is also sometimes known as the City of Death. It takes its name and reputation from its ruler Lerotra’hh the Death Empress of Khazan. Khazan was founded and built by a mighty wizard of the same name. It flourished under his benevolent rule for 666 years until it was attacked by the Orcish and Trollish hordes of Lerotra’hh. Khazan is one of the largest cities on the continent of Rrr’lff with a sizable population of Orcs, Trolls, Ogres, Dwarves, and other beings generally considered as Monsters by the human inhabitants of such places as Khosht. But the reign of terror has mellowed over the years until now most of the bloodletting takes place in the Arena. This new edition includes new dT&T options, more art, pre-rolled opponents and pre-rolled characters you can use, along with a full-color map of the Trollworld and the City of Khazan.

This Deluxe Tunnels & Trolls solitaire is open to all types and levels of individual characters, whether elf, dwarf or minotaur, wizard rogue or warrior. Just remember, the more you fight in the arena, the tougher will be the foes sent against you!

225890.name: The Pool
225890.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Pool is a very simple game system that promotes player and GM creative collaboration through an easy dice pool gambling mechanic. This is a game system only. Bring your own imagination.

User summary:

This commercial version of the game was released in 2017.

225891.name: Suntarynn Campaign Setting Preview
225891.description:
From the introduction:

The most important aspect that anyone will need to know is this: Suntarynn was once a normal planet, like most other campaign settings, but is one no longer. The world was in the process of dying. The gods ripped the worlds apart, saved the good parts, and reformed them into another world. (This event is known among the inhabitants of Suntarynn as The Reshaping.) This new world, however, is simply a flat plane that floats in a misty void. The void, the world, the weather within the world - everything is kept together and running properly by the gods or by those appointed by them.

225892.name: Unmeiryoku
225892.description:
User Summary:
運命力 (Unmeiryoku) is a dice-rolling game by the doujin circle カレーラーメン (in English: Curry Ramen'). It is based in the Project Touhou universe, with character cards representing various characters from the Project Touhou universe, drawn by many different artists (see below).

The game box contains 8 dice, 54 characters cards (6 x 9 characters) and 6 rules summary cards.

The players all start with the Daiyousei character card. They take turns at rolling dice.

More specifically, a player's turn consists of:
1. You throw initially 3 dice
2. You may use as many character cards you have in your possession to tweak that initial roll. The effects could be to change the dice value or add more dice for instance.
3. After modification, if you achieve a specific condition you can get a new character card which you will be able to use at your next run. Now your turn ends.

The game continues until a player manages to get the Flandre character card.

Note: The rulebook is in Japanese but no Japanese is needed for playing the game as the cards only have symbols (dice sides and numbers).

Publisher's summary:

Twist your　'Fate' !

You think it's over? But it's not !
Add dice, remove dice, use spells to alter your luck and be the first to rejoin with Flandre !

運命を捻じ曲げろ！

賽は投げられた？関係ないね！
ダイス目を増やし、減らし、逆転させフランドールの元まで辿りつけ！

カレーラーメンのカードゲーム第二弾『運命力』！
今度はひたすらダイスを振りまくるゲームです。

225893.name: Twenty Quick Tiefling NPCs
225893.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Do your players catch you out sometimes by suddenly expressing an interest in some random NPC who you never planned out because they weren't important? Do you sometimes struggle to come up with names for all the NPCs you are populating your setting with?

Either way this document will help!

Twenty NPCs described in just enough detail to make them quick to insert or adapt as needed.

225894.name: Twenty Quick Elf NPCs
225894.description:
User summary:

This item presents twenty pre-generated non-player characters. Enough detail is provided to allow them to be used as drop-in personas with minimal preparation.

225895.name: Twenty Quick Dwarf NPCs
225895.description:
User summary:

This item presents twenty pre-generated non-player characters. Enough detail is provided to allow them to be used as drop-in personas with minimal preparation.

225896.name: Fifty Quick Human NPCs
225896.description:
User summary:

This item presents fifty pre-generated non-player characters. Enough details are provided to allow them to be used as drop-in personas with minimal preparation.

225897.name: Play with Balloon
225897.description:
This game consist of 3 modes; Hit up , Hit up Vs Blow up and VolleyBalloon.

Source: The Developer Website.

225898.name: Holobunnies: Pause Cafe
225898.description:
Holobunnies: Pause Café is the Holobunnies appetizer you didn't know you wanted: three little games in one adorable and quirky package!

Source: The Game Website.

225899.name: Train Mechanic Simulator 2017
225899.description:
User Summary

Take your opportunity as real Train Mechanic. Find locomotives around game world that needs your help and repair them in one of 3 workshops localized in huge 25 km2 open world.

225900.name: Battle for Orion 2
225900.description:
Earth has been destroyed. Mankind is fractured. The galaxy is at war. But one hope remains: a new home for mankind. Probes detected a habitable planet in the Orion sector. You must fight your way to it, but nothing is as it seems. A more devious plan is underway that threatens the entire galaxy.

Source: The Developer Website.

225901.name: EmbodyMe
225901.description:
Make a real hologram of Princess Leia from Star Wars! EmbodyMe is an application that lets you easily create a realistic avatar of yourself from a single photo of your face and communicate with people in various ways as if you were really talking to them in person.

Source: The Game Website.

225902.name: Shadows 2: Perfidia
225902.description:
User Summary

Explore a darkened office complex and uncover the truth behind the horrifying events that have befallen its inhabitants.

225903.name: 994 W 24th
225903.description:
User Summary

Interactable cartoon playground with climbing.

225904.name: Radioactive
225904.description:
User Summary

Open world zombie survival game.

225905.name: In Vitra
225905.description:
https://www.facebook.com/InVitraGame

Is there any truth to those rumours of a mysterious affliction spreading all over -In Vitra- ? The four heroes of this role-playing game with a turn-based combat system embark on an epic quest for a cure – and chance upon a far bigger mystery.

225906.name: Demonheart
225906.description:
Demonheart is a first-person visual novel in a dark fantasy setting, featuring a female protagonist whose personality is completely up to the player thanks to extensive dialog choices. The game consists of 5 chapters to be released throughout 2017.

Source: The Developer Website.

225907.description:
Eat, Prey, Live is a set of three playable scenarios for This Is Not a Test designed to test the mettle, strength, and survivability of your warband. Each scenario introduces a new wasteland creature or hazard and provides additional depth to the history and (de)evolution of the Tri-State Wasteland.

Eat, Prey, Live features the following:

New Scenario (Eat) – Your warband will need more than a rod and real to bring these fish home. Look out for giant mutant crabs.

New Scenario (Prey) – Mutant turkeys are on the menu, but things may get a little explosive.

New Scenario (Live) – This is playing TNT on hard mode! Can your warband survive fall out from the fallout!
225907.name: This Is Not a Test: Eat, Prey, Live

225908.description:
Light Hunters: Battalion of Darkness is a Heroic Fantasy card game, for 2-8 players, opposing two teams and for everyone. Form your battalions, choose your heroes, and crush the opposite team to return to the Light!

Story

Mighty heroes from a far-off land, now exiled to this dark forest, you once shone bright amongst your fellow men, but are now doomed to roam the darkness. Surrounded by crooks, you now seek the former glory of your past.

Show the true hero you are, and regain your freedom at last. There still remains a glimmer of hope for you to return to your native land. Join forces with other heroes, and lead your camp to victory.Summon the spirits of light, and harness their energy. Fulfil your destiny, and destroy the enemy battalion. Once victorious, you may finally return to your people.

Far from your prison, the gods will forgive you at last."

How to Play


Set up


Constitute 2 teams, and place them face to face. Each player can use one or several heroes, the total number of heroes of each team must be equivalent.


Progression of the Game


Light Hunters is a turn-based card game in which the possibilities increase as the game progresses. Each round is equivalent to its Ether level: 1st round = Ether level at 1, 2nd round = Ether level at 2, up to 5 max.


Progression of a Hero Round


During a round every hero plays 1 time. To play a skill of a hero we have to refer to the Spirits of Light cards and to the Ether level available for the round. We can choose to play or not, if we choose to play for the round, we have to evoke the skill used on the opposite team and discard one or several Spirits of Light cards consumed.

The round of the hero is then finished, it belongs to the following hero to begin his turn. When all the heroes have played, we moved on the next round by increasing the Ether level +1.

End of the Game

When a battalion killed the enemy camp, it gains the victory. All the heroes from the remaining battalion is then indicated winners, and worthy to get back to their world, free and full of glory.

Content of the Game

8 "Hero" cards + 1 "Skeleton" card
70 Spirits of Light cards

24 Dawn cards
16 Shimmer cards
14 New day cards
12 Beam cards
4 Illumination cards




40 tokens

20 1-point health tokens
10 3-point health tokens
10 5-point health tokens




Rules booklet
225908.name: Light Hunters: Battalion of Darkness

225909.name: Inferno sugli Altipiani, 1916
225909.description:
Inferno sugli Altipiani 1916 is the game in the first issue of the Italian magazine Para Bellum.
Inferno sugli Altopiani is a game about the Spring 1916 Austro-Hungarian offensive on the Italian Front, aimed to drive to Vicenza and the Veneto plain, west of Venice, cutting off the whole front in Carnia and along the Isonzo river. One player controls the Austro-Hungarian forces, the other the Italian forces. Each player attempts to achieve, or maintain, geographical objectives to attain the victory.
The game is in italian, but you can download the English rules on the site.

225910.name: Terrors of London
225910.description:
Description from the publisher:

Terrors of London is a competitive deck-builder with a Victorian horror theme. It has four factions: Undead, Beast, Mortal and Spirit. Each faction has two Overlords from which to choose from. Each Overlord has a unique ability as well as two Influence cards to add to a player's starting deck.

During the game, players will purchase monsters and powerful item cards called Relics from a central market. As a player’s deck becomes more powerful, they’ll be able to use Terrors of London’s unique Horde system to combine multiple faction monsters together to create powerful synergies to defeat their opponent. The first player to defeat their opponent’s Overlord wins the game.
Terrors of London is intended for two players but comes with a four player variant included in the core game.

Terrors of London is a complex but simple to learn card game that plays in under 30 minutes.

225912.name: Belagerungsspiel
225912.description:
This mid-19th century game is quite different from the asymmetric movement game of the same name. This is strictly a die-rolling game, albeit also asymmetrical.

The board is a rectangular sheet of paper showing six artillery pieces behind earthworks firing at a multi-turreted castle. The castle walls are marked with 28 combinations of 2D6, some duplicated, while four piles of rocks in front of the castle are marked with doubles 1 through 4. (The main gates are marked with doubles 5 and 6.)

Above the castle are six spaces decorated with artillery pieces, each with a single 2D6 combination, and empty squares covering the rest of the possibilities. Players roll 2D6 alternately, and to win, the attacking player must destroy all the segments of the castle before the defending player rolls the six combinations needed to destroy his guns.

The game name and publication date of 1840 are handwritten on the reverse of the game sheet.

225913.name: Graph Wars
225913.description:
User Summary

Graph Wars is a strategy game, which can be played by up to four players on a field resembling a sheet of graph paper. Players enter the game by occupying a corner of the field with a “home” mark and subsequently take turns expanding their positions on the board with additional marks and attacking other players' positions. The object of the game is to reach and block out opponents' homes until the player is the last remaining player on the field. Game board dimensions, number of moves per turn, and number of players can be controlled by players, leading to different strategies and lengths of play.

225914.name: Return to Fel'Valashar
225914.description: This page does not exist. You can edit this page to create it.

225920.name: Batman Miniature Game: Professor Pyg & Dollotrons
225920.description: This expansion to the Batman Miniature Game introduces Professor Pyg and his Dollotrons. This white metal kit comes ready to assemble and paint.

225924.name: Pippi
225924.description: Collect puzzle pieces to you Pippi-puzzle. When you land on your color, grab a puzzle piece. You can also get pieces by making your best funny face, sing a Pippi song, or pantomiming animals. But beware

225930.name: Coin Store
225930.description:
The object of the game is to move by a throw of the dice and get all four of your men to the "Coin Store" first for the highest extra bonus on coin values (collected via "Coin Cards" accumulated on the way there). Your men may only move into play with a roll of a one on one of the dice. If more than one man is in play, the roll may be split with each man moving the number of spaces on one die. If doubles are thrown the player gets another roll. A man can only enter the "Coin Store" with an exact number. If more than one man is in play, the roll can be split to allow a man to enter with the exact number.

The player with the highest total of values (plus the bonus), as indicated on the "Coin Cards" held by each player at the end of the game is the winner. All players must finish because lesser bonuses are awarded for both second and third place and the player who finishes first may not necessarily finish with the highest total.

225931.name: Kingdom Wars 2: Battles
225931.description:
Kingdom Wars 2: Battles brings a fresh perspective on the fantasy real-time Strategy genre, combining the best of Zombie survival and long term crafting with complex fast-paced city-building and skirmish siege combat. All in a beautifully, yet gory game world where players fight across the epic battlefields in multiplayer skirmish and coop with thousands of other players. And with an episodic singleplayer campaign bringing epic storytelling, with countless battles and adventures. New Episodes will be released as a free expansion pack, every few months.

Episodic Singleplayer Campaign
Kingdom Wars 2: Battles comes complete with an epic story-driven singleplayer campaign, as well as progressive multiplayer storytelling. Providing hours of engaging cinematic narrative, and original gameplay, campaign tells the story of the three great races, trying to survive in a world engulfed by total war. Each new episode will continue both the singleplayer and multiplayer story-arcs as well as introduce new races and locations. And in best Reverie World Studios traditions, new episodes will be released as a free expansion pack, every few months.

Stunning Siege Combat
Realistic medieval siege combat brings fresh gameplay to the Strategy genre, with intricate stronghold construction, and over 25 defensive and offensive siege weapons. Ram the enemy gates, scale the walls with ladders and siege towers, and unleash trebuchet bombardments, while building your own strongholds and citadels protected by boiling oil and wall-mounted catapults.

Complex Crafting System
To provide meaning long-term gameplay, KW2B features full crafting system, with over two hundred combinations, from dozens of components from blueprints and materials to legendary items and relics. Crafting is tied into every aspect of the game, from crafting new deadly siege weapons and buildings, to creating new game cards, or researching new industrial technologies. This minigame is complete with intricate ways of acquiring crafting components, and full support for player to player trading, and persistent item crafting economy.

MMO Community Environment
While all online interaction is completely optional, players can experience persistent mmo environment, with huge player community waiting to welcome you. Make friends, join guilds and alliances, master player driven crafting economy, engage friends in coop and challenges, or compete to become the ultimate warrior in progressive player ranking and tournaments.

Skirmish Gameplay
KW2B offers complex city-building and economy model in a fast paced skirmish environment, offering extremely wide range of short-term and long-term strategic options. With free base building, intricate stronghold design, realistic siege combat, complex economic model, and dozens of units – players can craft the ultimate playing style – from numerous rushing opportunities, to a defensive play-style, that can still bring victory.

Long term tech-tree progression
As players fights across the battlefields, his avatar level ups unlocking various crafting combination to create one of many game cards. This complex system adds a great deal of management and long-term strategic thinking as players unlock and build their card decks to ensure victory in battle.

Three truly Distinct Races
Featuring three truly distinct civilizations: Humans, Orcs and Elves – KW2:B brings players three unique was to play the game, and countless hours of late-game progression for each race. Every aspect of each race was designed to be unique – from economy, to base building, unit roles and tactics. Each race comes complete with over 60 unique crafting opportunities, with unique tech-tree progressions and their own deck of playing cards.

Strategic Card Game
As players’ fights across the battlefields, strategic card game comes into play. Players can build endless combinations of playable card decks that they acquire through crafting. During multiplayer battles players will pit their decks against each other to try and turn the tide of a battle. This complex system adds a great deal of management and long-term strategic thinking.

Source: The Game Website.

225933.name: Gateway: The Tabletop Roleplaying Game
225933.description:
GATEWAY is a Simple, Rules-Light, Fast Paced, and Universal d20 ruleset that can be used for getting people who have never played a roleplaying game into the hobby. This system also allows for any setting or theme as well so it is great for Veteran Players and Game Masters to run really fun "One Shot" adventures.

The rules for the game are based around some of the mechanics from the most popular roleplaying game in the world's 5th Edition, but simplifying them even more. This product can be used to excite new people into the hobby, hence the name "Gateway". You can even expand the rules of GATEWAY to incorporate whatever d20 system you want to move your players over to.

All in all, the moral of this game system is to just have the most FUN you can have playing it in the easiest way possible.

This rule system includes the following:

6 Pages of Rules for Players and a Game Masters Section
2 Pages of Expanded Rules for Character Creation and a Hit Point Variant
1 Page Quick Reference Sheet to be used during gameplay
1 Page Character Sheet (Printable or Form Fillable Options!)
Formated in a easily accessible PDF and also Printer Friendly option

225934.name: Gateway Character Sheet
225934.description:
User summary:

Three formats of the character sheet are available as print-and-play components. One of them uses a PDF template to allow data entry prior to save or print.

225935.name: Gateway Quick Reference Sheet
225935.description: This page does not exist. You can edit this page to create it.

225938.name: ¿Los ves?
225938.description:
This is a visual perception game.

There are always two equal drawings ... But only two!
Each card has 8 items and one and only one is repeated in another card. Can you find it?

¿Los ves? ("Do you see them?") is a set of multiple and very entertaining games of concentration and visual perception both for children and adults.

Description (Spanish):

Siempre hay dos iguales... Pero solo dos! Cada carta tiene 8 elementos, y uno y solo uno, está repetido en otra carta ¿puedes encontrarlo?

¿Los Ves? es un set de múltiples y muy entretenidos juegos de concentración y percepción visual para grandes y chicos.

Juegos de percepción visual

225940.name: QUARTINO
225940.description:
QUARTINO is strategic board game for 2 to 6 players.
In turns, players introduce one, two or four pieces into play until achieving combination at their cards. Players then remove pieces the captured combination. Number of placed pieces is driven by two rules - 4 pieces in one column and 4 pieces of one color on board. Wins the one who will first achieve combination at their 4 cards. The game is also a great tool for training attention, spatial imagination and logical thinking. Are you ready to combine in three dimensions?

225941.name: TimeTrax
videogameversion: English ZX Spectrum (Bug-Byte re-release) cassette edition
225941.description:
From the back of the box:

Just after the Holocaust you wouldn't think anything else could go wrong now would you? There you were sitting peacefully in your cellar, trying to have the nervous breakdown you've earned and the next thing you know you're setting out through the Portals to stop the Evil One rending asunder the fabric of Creation. Some days nothing goes right...

An amazing, all-action, animated adventure across the ages of Man to save civilisation. You'll be able to start playing it in minutes but you mightn't finish it for years?

WARNING: This game could damage your social life. TIMETRAX is an addictive habit.

From the inlay:

It's post holocaust and the game starts in your cosy cellar. The most powerful 8 minds in creation have had their key belongings stolen by the Evil One and placed in time. As they search they open the Time Portals and the Dark Ones are pouring into Earth History. You must find the items, return them and seal the portals by lining up the correct 4 Runes and casting a spell.

User Summary:

The original C64 version was by Paul Clancy.
Conversions were by Binary Design.

225942.name: Kohdan-class Osaka
225942.description:
Issue games of Game Journal #59.

Twin games of Osaka Winter campaign and Summer campaign.

Both games are easy to learn and play.
Chit activation with no ZOC. Each unit without stack execute operation including both of movement and attack.
Combat is resolved by attacker's fire and defender's fire. The higher moral fires first.

225943.name: Panzer Attack
videogameversion: English / European ZX Spectrum cassette edition
225943.description:
From the inlay:

Panzer Attack is an all graphics wargame for one player, against the computer, re-enacting the Battle of the Bulge.

YOU play the part of General Hodges, commander of the U.S. First Army in the Ardennes.

There are fully detailed playing instructions and tactical hints contained WITHIN the program. There is NO SEPARATE instruction booklet with this game.

Credits:

By R. Packer & T. Kitchener
MSX Version By David Howse PhD

225946.name: Into Edderkop's Lair
225946.description:
A perilous quest from the Earl of Anders’ Point

From the Introduction:

A giant spider, known by the locals as Edderkop, has been terrorising the nearby village of Anders’ Point. Coming out of its lair at night, Edderkop has been devouring local livestock and, most recently, the youngest son of the local landowner has disappeared. It is thought Edderkop is responsible. The giant spider’s incursions are becoming more and more frequent, and the villagers are desperate for help.

A 4-hour adventure for 1st - 2nd level characters.

225947.name: Reef of Madness
225947.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Named for the sapphire blue squid found in great number just off the coast, Bluesquid Village is an idyllic fishing village a few days hike from the nearest colony of Amn. Far removed from the troubles of rough and tumble outlands such as the Sword Coast, this peaceful village is an attractive vacation destination for weary adventurers. Recently however, locals and travellers alike have been subjected to strange dreams and odd visions of the cosmos. The tides are pulling something maddening to Bluesquid Village.

225948.name: A Pirate's Life For Me
225948.description: This page does not exist. You can edit this page to create it.

225949.name: Delve Gamemaster's Guide
225949.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Ready to take command of the dungeon? The Gamemaster's Guide expands the rules for Delve: Dynamic Dungeon Adventure. Learn the rules for controlling monsters and hazards the likes of which your adventurers can only imagine!

225951.name: Red Baron (1983/ZX Spectrum)
225951.description:
From the inlay:

Red Baron is a real time simulation of World War 1 plane to plane combat in which you, as the pilot of a Sopwith Camel are pitted against the best air aces of the German airforce.

Ruthlessness, cunning, determination and quick reactions are essential to achieving your objective - elimination of German air supremacy in W. Europe.

225952.name: Warmaster Pack
225952.description:
User Summary

A collection of four games in M.C. Lothlorien's Warmaster series. Most are strategy games, while Red Baron is a WWI flight simulator.

225964.name: Rod and Reproof
225964.description:
From the introduction:

1992. The Cold War formally ends. George Bush and Bill Clinton battle for the White House. Los Angeles is engulfed in riots. The Supreme Court reaffirms a woman’s right to abortion.

But we’re all kids, and if we know about any of this, we don’t care.

While our parents worry about the state of the world, we spend the summer of 1992 roaming the suburbs of northern Utah on bicycles, sneaking into cemeteries, climbing onto the roof of the elementary school, and playing night games for hours on end. We strain against obligations levied by parents and church, but nothing will stop this from being the best summer ever.

225965.name: Camp Death: The Final Chapter
225965.description: This page does not exist. You can edit this page to create it.

225966.description:
Roll all eight dice or roll them one at a time. Weave your pirate story together using the figures on each die. If you roll the red superpower symbol, you may add a special ability to your character.

Each player can tell a story just for fun, or take turns telling a story from the same dice, and vote for the best-told story. The game is designed primarily for language-learners.

Excitement, adventure and super powers: these dice bring fun into every story! Let them inspire you on a daring pirate adventure story. And with some luck, the dice even give your hero super powers!

There are no limits to your imagination ...

~~~~~

Spannung, Abenteuer und Super-Kräfte: Diese Würfel bringen Pepp in jede Geschichte! Lass dich von ihnen zu einer verwegenen Piraten-Abenteuer-Geschichte inspirieren. Und mit etwas Glück verleihen die Würfel deinem Helden sogar Super-Kräfte!

Deiner Phantasie sind keine Grenzen gesetzt ...
225966.name: Magische Geschichten Würfel

225967.name: Spear of Destiny (2017)
225967.description:
User Summary

Several centuries have passed since Light's Lords defeated them with the spear of destiny.

225968.name: Tabula Rasa
225968.description:
Description from the publisher:

In Tabula Rasa, 2-5 Players compete to successfully raid one of the many dungeons and lairs of Tabaine. But, players will not be "raiding" the dungeons and lairs for just treasure, but to help but an end to the threat that resides there. The game includes bags for each player to keep track of their pool of crystals. These gems serve as their pool, or "hand".

One each turn, players spend their crystals to performs actions and abilities, bringing them deeper into the threats lair, or allowing them to confront and defeat different threats and minions that appear during the game.

Players will be able to build a better pool of Crystals to go back into their bag, as each time they must draw but cannot, their discard pile of used crystals goes back into the back, gets shaken up and drawn from again. Having a better or stronger pool gives you the ability to maximize your turns!

Some crystals fuel abilities, some are bad and need to be culled, and some are blank slates that slow you down. Building a good pool will help you complete quests and defeat minions, advancing the boss's threat track.

The Boss of the dungeon or lair isn't just going to sit back either. Their are Crystals that draw their ire, Minions that attempt to stop you, and of course and as the game progresses on the threat track, when it reaches it's threshold, players ALL confront the boss for additional points.

When the boss is defeated, players count up their Glory and the winner's legend rings out through the land!

225969.name: Gochi-Show!
225969.description:
User Summary

A visual novel about cooking various Japanese dishes.

225970.name: Dinotopia: First Flight Board Game
225970.description: Dinotopia: First Flight is the third Dinotopia book written by James Gurney. The first edition of the book included a fold-out board game. The front cover opens up to reveal an easy-to-learn board game. By Detaching the game cards from the back of the book, players can join Gideon on his adventures, experiencing his crushing setbacks and his high-flying triumphs.

225971.name: Roomscale Coaster
225971.description:
VR game.

Roomscale Coaster is an intense, fast paced game designed to take full advantage of your playspace. Dodge, duck and collect to increase your high-score as your fly through the air on a sci-fi platform.

Source: The Developer Website.

225972.name: Das Eisenbahnspiel
225972.description:
The players have to get their trains from the main station at the center of the game board to space 50 of one of the six destination stations. Movement is determined by a standard die (1-6) and a color-die (red, white, green), which has the following meanings:
white: free track, the train moves the double number of spaces.
red: blocked track, the train misses a turn.
green: the train moves backward.
If a train gets to a rail junction, the player has to raise his red flag, to signal that the trains on the other tracks have to wait till he passed the junction and removes the flag.
The first player to reach his destination station wins the game.

225973.name: The Purge Day
225973.description:
Something strange has happened. No one knows what. It is unstoppable. Our civilization is almost dead but Jack Bowman has to save his wife. Do you want to know how this story finishes?

Choose your weapon and fight against alien swarm in Asian agglomeration.

The Purge Day is the first person narrative, immersive horror shooter designed exclusively for VR.

Source: The Developer Website.

225974.description:
The worlds of Vikings and Pirates are about to collide!

There are few crews on the high seas more feared than the Hammers of Ragnarok. These sea-faring Vikings rejoice in the violence and bloodshed in battle. The only thing better than earning valuable booty from their raids would be to die in battle.

The Hammers of Ragnarok are a complete expansion faction for Rum and Bones Second Tide with their own Heroes, Tide cards, Deckhands, and ships. Any pirate out there will be quaking in their pantaloons when they spot the Hammers’ colors flying.

This is an expansion. The Rum & Bones: Second Tide core box is required to play.

Features:


Long Ships - The Hammers of Ragnarok have their own long ships for engaging in battle with rival pirate forces!
Viking Heroes - Five new Viking Heroes will lead their forces to take home some shiny pirate treasure or die in glorious battle. They’re fine either way.
High Tide - With their own Tide deck to draw on for support, the Hammers of Ragnarok will be a force to be reckoned with!
225974.name: Rum & Bones: Hammers of Ragnarok

225975.description:
These Heroes make a hearty crew, for the right price.

A good pirate captain is always on the lookout for some new recruits. They’ll lose some crew to scurvy, sunken ships, and in rare cases, retirement, so having a healthy supply of replacements on hand is crucial.

The Mercenaries Heroes Chest for Rum and Bones Second Tide, adds ten new Heroes willing to join any faction for the right price. These Heroes come with their own set of skills and special attacks. Any crew would be happy to have them on board!

This is an expansion. The Rum & Bones: Second Tide core game is required to play.

Features:


Mini Mercenaries - All ten of the included Mercenaries have their own highly detailed miniature figure and Hero Dashboards, allowing them to join any pirate crew.
Custom Cards - Each Hero comes with their own Skill cards that can be used to customize their abilities. As the game progresses, players will be able to choose how to develop them.
225975.name: Rum & Bones: Second Tide – Mercenaries Heroes Chest

225976.name: Emperor's Choice
225976.description:
In 221 BC, Emperor Qin Shihuang finally united China after a long period of internal conflict in which China was divided by warring provinces. With this unprecedented authority, Emperor Qin made a number of influential lasting reforms and carried out impactful large-scale projects which would last for centuries. Players are powerful subordinates of the Emperor, promoting the Emperor’s various policies and projects while manipulating their own standing within the Imperial Court. To do so, they need to build sections of the Great Wall, amass troops and carriages, recruit philosophers and academics as well as collect important literature. Players will also need to employ and properly utilize characters within the Imperial Court. Which player can exert the greatest influence and make their achievements go down in the annals of history?

The player with the most victory points (VP) at the end of 6 rounds will be the winner. Players earn VP by presenting their achievements according to the Emperor’s policies. However, the Emperor’s policies are constantly subject to influence and change…

225977.description:
In Sheep 'n' Sheep, players are shepherds who are herding and arranging sheep on their own pastures. However, sheep are picky in different ways: there are sheep who want to be alone and sheep who want to be in pairs and so on. Which player can manage to arrange sheep in the prettiest formation while still satisfying the fussy sheep?

Each player places sheep cards in their own playing area (pasture) to earn the most victory points. There are grouping conditions on each card to gain VP. Cards that are connected orthogonally of the same type (to the top, bottom, right or left) are called a "group". Therefore, the main way to earn VP is to group sheep together in the head count that they desire to be grouped.
225977.name: Sheep 'n' Sheep

225979.description:
Description from the designer:

In Matchmaker, you take characters under your wing and try to find them suitable partners. Some characters want to fall in hopelessly in love but others are more pragmatic - or just plain mercenary!

You'll discover your characters’ motives with the roll of a dice. Each character has a preference which makes them more likely to prefer a particular ‘trait’ - Charm, Virtue, Rank or Fortune.

Making a suitable match – for example marrying one of your gold-diggers to a rich suitor – will earn you more prestige. The player who earns the most prestige wins the game.
You can gain even more prestige by earning the approval of patrons. Mrs Norris only approves of people with a good fortune whereas Lady Bertram is more impressed by charm.

In addition to making matches, you can invite characters to prestigious residences to boost your prestige still further. Make sure you invite the right sort of guest, they don't approve of riffraff at Mansfield Park!

The original Matchmaker card game was intended for social play (3 or more players) but I received many requests for a 2-player variant. Jane Austen's Matchmaker: Chapter 2 was designed with this in mind.

Whether you play head to head or with up to three other players, you must assess each proposal and your chances of coming out on top, before you accept or decline.
225979.name: Jane Austen's Matchmaker: Chapter Two

225980.name: The Colonists: The Imperial Post
225980.description: Solo scenario provided for free by Mayfair Games on their website that involves establishing relationships with the Envoy Colony.

225981.name: Penguin Trap
225981.description:
An evolution of the classic Don't Break the Ice, using hexagonal blocks in two colours instead of square, which adds a little more strategy. Also added is a spinner which dictates which colour of block a player should attempt to remove.

Apparently popular in China and spreading worldwide under a variety of English translations.

225982.name: Tiny Epic Quest: Quest for the Golden Mushrooms
225982.description:
In this mini-expansion the goblins have captured some of the most magical mushroom folk of the land and the heroes that can rescue them will be generously rewarded!

Quest for the Golden Mushrooms adds a capture-the-flag element to Tiny Epic Quest, as well as some additional variability through the addition of Golden Grotto Map Cards!

Note: This is included in the deluxe edition of Tiny Epic Quest

225983.name: Flinthook
225983.description:
In a galaxy filled with scoundrels and miscreants, everyone seeks treasure and riches!
But when a malevolent treasure hunter hatches a sinister plan to unleash an ancient evil to threaten the cosmos itself, Flinthook, the galaxy's smallest but toughest pirate zips into action!
Be ready to jump, zip and blast around the meanest fleets the galaxy has to offer!
Whether using time-slowing powers or his trusty Blasma Pistol, Flinthook is ready to take on all pirates, steal treasure and save the galaxy itself!

Source: The Game Website.

225984.name: Tat's All Folks!
225984.description:
Tat's All Folks! is a 2 player worker placement micro-game based on American traditional tattoo artwork. The two players are rival tattooers in a shop, filling in available spots with their signature piece to gain more clients than the other and become known as the best.

Tat's All Folks! was built for economy, of both space and price. The modular game board is made of 6 double sided cards, creating 64 possible board permutations. 2 of the cards function as score trackers, sliding along the numerical track created by the remaining 4 cards on the board. A 7th card contains all the rules for gameplay, while a final 8th card can be cut up and used as game pieces. The entire game could easily fit in your wallet!

Following standard worker placement rules, the two players will alternate placing their 3 game pieces on the board to perform listed actions and gain/lose clients over the course of multiple rounds. Each player also has a single use special move, called the "Dead Man's Switch," that when activated grants them another immediate turn, which can make or break a player's strategy. The first player to reach 9 clients wins the game.

225988.name: Burst Out Laughing Gas
225988.description: Each card in a deck displays three pairs of phrases. The final word or words of the first phrase of a pair is/are the same as the first word or words of the second phrase of the pair. Within a time limit, a player tries to get his teammates to guess all six phrases and all three "combolutions" of two phrases on the card. Collect a token for each guessed combolution. The first team to twenty tokens wins.

225989.name: Rhino: The Game
225989.description: Rhino: The Game is a trick-taking game in the vein of Oh Hell. The game is played with a 52-card deck with cards numbered 0 through 12 in each of four suits. Seven cards are dealt to each player in the first round, six in the second round, and so on down to one and then back up to seven for a total of 13 rounds, at the end of which the highest score wins. Players are penalized both for under-estimating and for over-estimating their bids. Each player also receives five tokens with differing benefits that he may play once each over the course of the game.

225991.name: Tiny Polka Dot
225991.description: Tiny Polka Dot is a set of 66 square cards in six suits numbered zero to ten. Five suits feature dots arranged in different ways and in different colors. The sixth suit consists of the numerals zero through ten. The set comes with instructions to play 16 games, mostly for children of various ages.

225992.name: The Smash Hits Game
225992.description:
"Could you become the richest, swankiest, most successful pop star in the world? Release records! Have hits! make pots of cash!

First you have to get a music record out and battle your way to the top of the hit parade against the other players. But keep your wits about you, because you'll have to use your skill and judgement to determine when to cash in on your chart success before you tumble down pop's dastardly dumper!"

Players move around the board collecting pieces to create their records. There are four pieces to every record A,B,C and D. A and B make the song name and C and D make up the first line of the single. You have to then make up, oh and also, sing the next line for your single to make it into the charts.

Whilst moving around the board you can steal, pass and lose un-used pieces of the record. But once it's created and in the charts you start to move up the charts and cash in on the popularity. Game play moves clockwise around the board and spaces and action/question cards indicate what the players must do to move play along. create the most successful records and collect money at the right time (preferably before the records slumps) to win!

225993.name: Tic Tac Whoa!
225993.description: Tic Tac Whoa! consists of a deck of 17 cards that display an "X" and 17 cards that display an "O". This deck can be used to play five games on a three by three grid. The rules common to all the games are (i) that a player plays both the "X" cards and the "O" cards, (ii) that a player can score by getting three in a row of either symbol, and (iii) that same-symbol cards cannot be played on top of each other.

225994.name: Dungeon Dice: Dual Artifact Pack
225994.description:
This optional expansion adds unique new weapons that count as multiple weapon types.

Contains

Morning Star
Songbow
Long knife
Halberd
Swift Bo Staff
Magic Hand Armor

225995.description:
The Cauldron is an unofficial fan expansion intended for use with the Sentinels of the Multiverse® card game by Greater Than Games®, created by user Matthew Bishop (Tosx), his old roommate and his brother.

The "Experimental" set includes 3 heroes, 3 villains and 1 environment:

Heroes:
-Cricket
-Cypher
-Titan

Villains:
-Oriphel
-Swarm Eater
-Vector

Environment:
-The Cybersphere
225995.name: The Cauldron: Experimental (fan expansion to Sentinels of the Multiverse)

225996.description:
The Cauldron is an unofficial fan expansion intended for use with the Sentinels of the Multiverse® card game by Greater Than Games®, created by user Matthew Bishop (Tosx), his old roommate and his brother.

The "Stormfall" set includes 3 heroes, 3 villains and 1 environment:

Heroes:
-Echelon

-Magnificent Mara

Villains:

-Menagerie
-Phase

Environment:
-Superstorm Akela
225996.name: The Cauldron: Stormfall (fan expansion to Sentinels of the Multiverse)

This deck contains alternate character cards for Cauldron hero and villain decks. These decks (the Cauldron Base Set and Cauldron: Experimental) are available separately and are needed to play.

The following cards are included in this pack:

-Ace of Swords Baccarat hero character card
-Ace of Sorrows Baccarat hero character card
-Lady of the Wood: Season of Change hero character card
-Starlight: Genesis hero character card
-Nightlore Council: Starlight hero character cards
-First Response Doc Havoc hero character card
-First Response Cricket hero character card
-First Response Cypher hero character card
-First Response Vanish hero character card
-The Uncanny Quicksilver hero character card
-The Rune-Carved Stranger hero character card
-Tango One: Ghost Ops hero character card
-Shardmaster Malichae hero character card
-The Fair Knight hero character card
-The Berserker Knight hero character card
-Necro: Warden of Chaos hero character card
-The Ministry of Strategic Science Titan hero character card

-Evolved Anathema villain character cards
-Hydra Tiamat villain character cards

Chaos Necro promo designed by Geoffery Benedict. Evolved Anathema promo designed by D. Himes. Nightlore Starlight promo conceived by Hudson Caldeira.
225997.name: The Cauldron: Promo Pack #1 (fan expansion to Sentinels of the Multiverse)

225998.description:
Promo Pack #2 from the unofficial fan expansion "The Cauldron", intended for use with the Sentinels of the Multiverse® card game by Greater Than Games®. This deck contains more alternate character cards for Cauldron hero and villain decks. These decks (the Cauldron Base Set, Cauldron: Experimental, and Cauldron: Stormfall) are available separately and are needed to play.

The following cards are included in this pack:

-The Ministry of Strategic Science Malichae hero character card
-The Ministry of Strategic Science Lady of the Wood hero character card
-The Ministry of Strategic Science Magnificent Mara hero character card

1929 Knight, 1929 Mara, and MSS Mara promos designed by Geoffery Benedict. 1929 Tango One promo designed by Benton "Pricyprovinces" Winfrey. Renegade Cricket promo designed by Michael Hunter and Jonathan Richardson. 1929 Ram promo designed by Hudson Caldeira.
225998.name: The Cauldron: Promo Pack #2 (fan expansion to Sentinels of the Multiverse)

225999.name: Vecitas
225999.description:
User Summary

Vecitas is a fast paced multiplayer space shooter combined with singleplayer mode.

226000.name: Deep End
226000.description: The Deep End is a parkour platformer with entire room scale gameplay.
